Italic is building the next generation of digital commerce by pioneering a new global supply chain that removes brands, retailers, and all other middlemen. For consumers, we offer a curated selection of the highest quality products, produced by the same manufacturers as top brands, but sold at mass-market prices. For qualified manufacturers, we equip them with the tools to tap into a global market and build a revenue stream independent of the traditional supply chain.

As an Italic employee, your work will be on the cutting edge of the retail industry and you will work with the best that technology and product has to offer. Our culture is obsessed with the customer and manufacturer, and we make all of our decisions reflecting our mission to make quality goods accessible to everyone.

Italic is seeking a talented product designer to work on improving its overall digital experience and storefront. This is a critical role that requires a deep understanding of product design principles and the ability to work closely on a distributed engineering, product, and design team.

Note from the team:
Product design is weaved throughout the Italic organization and is a fundamental part of our DNA. Our founder & CEO is the one who still does all of the current web design and it's starting to hold us back. We need someone to fill this role and do a 10x better job so that he can get back to focusing on hiring. Just letting you know that this role is really, really important.
Responsibilities
Work together with our technology team to design new features and experiences that delight customers
Create repeatable style guides and design systems that adhere with our brand visual identity and apply them consistently
Adhere to deadlines and ensure clear communication together with Product Manager and Engineering team
Help QA features to confirm alignment with design specifications
Work with our Product Manager and engineering team to produce specifications, prototypes, and assets to ensure accurate delivery of the designs you create
Work together with our Product Manager to ideate and deliver assets on-time
Requirements
3+ years experience as a product designer at a fast-growing consumer-facing company
Strong experience with Figma, clear understanding of using auto-layouts, components, and layering
Experience with motion or prototyping is a plus, but not necessary
Italic is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We don't care about where you went to college or what fancy names are on your resume. Instead, we're looking for good people: good at work and have a good heart.

Email is the universal communication tool for work. It’s where you discuss work, answer questions, and talk to all of your customers, vendors, and partners. But email wasn’t designed for business and hasn’t evolved with the way you work with a team. So you’re dropping the ball, missing important context, and relying on dozens of siloed apps just to get the job done.

With more than 6,000 customers Front is reinventing the inbox so people can accomplish more together. We’ve created one place where you communicate internally and externally, gain context about customers and projects, and access all your other tools so you can be more efficient, more fulfilled, and ultimately happier at work.

With $138M in funding, Front is backed by Sequoia Capital, and other leading venture capital firms, as well as independent investors including top executives of Atlassian, Okta, Qualtrics, and Zoom. Front was recently named to the Forbes Cloud 100 2020, the definitive list of the top software companies in the world. We have also been recognized on LinkedIn’s 2020 Top Startups, Forbes’ Next Billion-Dollar Startups 2019, The New York Times’ The Next Wave of ‘Unicorn’ Start-Ups, Fortune’s Best Small Workplaces, and Glassdoor’s Best Places to Work.

We’re looking for a Senior Product Designer to be an integral part of the company's ambitious growth plans, partnering closely with Product, Engineering, Marketing, and Data Analytics teams to bring the core value of Front to new audiences across desktop, mobile and web.
What you'll do:
Develop growth strategies; working in collaboration with and managing feedback from multiple stakeholders and teams
Design and communicate your vision to the team using mock-ups, documentation, and prototypes
Collaborate and work closely with Product Design leadership, Designers, and Researchers across all teams
Establish partnerships with Engineering and Product to design meaningful, impactful metrics-driven solutions
What we're looking for:
5+ years of experience building and growing high-quality products (mobile, web, desktop)
Experience leading complex user and metrics inspired projects
Understanding of acquisition and conversion, metrics-driven design, and A/B experimentation
A portfolio of design projects that shows strong product design process and craft skills
Low ego and an eagerness to give and receive constructive feedback in a transparent work environment
Great communication skills and the ability to clearly articulate your design decisions and how they relate to the problem you’re solving
Front provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.

Please include URLs for an online portfolio in addition to resume. Submissions without a portfolio included will not be considered. Click here for tips on what to include in your portfolio.
Note: By applying to this position your application is automatically submitted to the following locations: Boulder, CO, USA; Kirkland, WA, USA; New York, NY, USA; San Bruno, CA, USA; Seattle, WA, USA; San Francisco, CA, USA; Sunnyvale, CA, USA; Mountain View, CA, USA

Minimum qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Design or equivalent practical experience.
Experience collaborating with multidisciplinary teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers, Content Strategists and Product Managers throughout the design process; creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes.
Experience designing across multiple platforms.
Portfolio highlighting multiple projects that demonstrates experiences crafting usable digital interfaces.
Preferred qualifications:
Master's degree in Design, Computer Science, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field.
8 years of relevant industry experience.
Ability to lead and ideate products from scratch and improve features, all with a user-centered design process.
Skills in communicating and influencing product design strategy.
Excellent problem-solving skills and familiarity with technical constraints and limitations as they apply to designing for platforms such as desktop and mobile (i.e. Android and iOS).
About the job


Design and user experience (UX) are at the forefront of everything we do. The job of an Interaction Designer is to envision how people experience our products and bring that vision to life in a way that feels inspired, refined and even magical. In an Interaction Designer role, you’ll take on complex tasks and transform them into intuitive, accessible and easy-to-use designs for billions of people around the world—from the first-time user to the sophisticated expert. Achieving this goal requires collaboration with teams of Designers, Researchers, Engineers and Product Managers throughout the design process—from creating user flows and wireframes to building user interface mockups and prototypes. At each stage, you will anticipate what our users need, advocate for them and ensure that the final product surprises and delights them.

We follow a simple but vital premise in the UX group: "Focus on the user and all else will follow." We're interested in our users and strive to learn everything we can about their behaviors, attitudes and emotions to help define the products and experiences we create. The UX team plays an integral part in gathering these insights and then using them to inspire and inform design. We are a multi-disciplinary team of interaction designers, visual designers, user researchers, content strategists and web developers who collaborate closely with each other and with engineering and product management to create innovative, usable, great-looking products that people love to use.

User experience is at the forefront of how we create intuitive, innovative, and beautiful products that people love. We strive to learn and understand our users’ needs, behaviors, and emotions to gather insights that inform product strategy and design. Our UX teams include designers, researchers, content strategists, and engineers who are passionate about quality, usability, and simplicity. We work on collaborative teams to solve complex challenges and craft experiences that highlight our products’ unique capabilities and personalities. Our work touches billions while exemplifying a key principle that is core to Google’s philosophy: “Focus on the user and all else will follow.”
Responsibilities
Collaborate with product managers, engineers, and cross-functional stakeholders to understand requirements, and provide creative, thoughtful solutions.
Communicate the user experience at various stages of the design process with wireframes, flow diagrams, storyboards, mockups, and/or high fidelity prototypes.
Integrate user feedback and business requirements into ongoing product experience updates.
Advocate for the prioritization of design centered changes, refinements, and improvements.

UX Designer, Visual Shopping

Job description
We are seeking a UX Designer for Visual Shopping. In this role, you will work with a cross-discipline, passionate team to conceptualize, define, and design how customers shop with video and visual content on Amazon. From diving deep to understand customer needs, to crafting effective and usable design patterns that form the foundation of visual shopping across Amazon, you practice collaboration and efficiency and help raise the bar for UX design within your team. As a UX designer, you are the multidisciplinary core of our design practice, and will creatively shape and drive the customer experience, while being a constant advocate for what is right for the customer. You are passionate about the power of video and visual imagery to inspire, inform, and help customers make product decisions.

About the Hiring Team
Amazons Shopping Design team makes Amazon more personal and human. We guide the vision and customer experience for shopping across mobile apps, web, and desktop. We design the customer journey from discovery and evaluation of products and programs, to writing and reading product reviews, to gifting and saving products for later, to checking out and completing purchases. Were also the team that defines the UX guidelines and design language that enables teams across Amazon to design on-brand shopping experiences efficiently and at scale. Our future-thinking projects push the bounds of what it means to shop and experience Amazon. We are designers, researchers, technologists, and inventors; we learn from each other. We invest in each of our team members by helping them build their unique careers.

Please include an online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating a history of creating customer-focused, simple and intuitive designs using best practices for usability.




Basic Qualifications

· Bachelor's or equivalent degree in Design, HCI or related field, or equivalent professional experience within the design field.
· 3-5 years of experience as a user experience designer, interaction designer, product designer, or similar role designing mobile, web, or other on-device applications.
· An online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating a history of creating customer-focused, simple and intuitive designs.



Preferred Qualifications

· Excellent communication and presentation skills
· Experience leading design projects in a collaborative multi-disciplinary team including designers, product managers, and software developers.
· Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Sketch, Illustrator, Invision, Flinto, Figma, or similar.
· A desire and ability to work with and for a diverse group of colleagues and customers.
· Passion for designing mobile experiences and working with video.
· Familiarity with user research methodologies and turning customer feedback into actionable findings.
· Familiarity with design systems and using global components for page design.
· Ability to deliver high-quality solutions in a rapid, iterative design and development environment.
· Experience working creatively around constraints and navigating ambiguous situations.
· Effectiveness in working across organizational boundaries to influence and deliver results.
· Experience working on a collaborative multi-disciplinary team that includes other designers, product managers .and software developers.
· Comprehensive knowledge of the latest design concepts and emerging trends in user-centered design.
· Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills; the ability to communicate complex concepts clearly and persuasively across different audiences and varying levels of the organization.
· Experience translating concepts into concrete depictions to clarify ideas and advance collaboration based on shared understanding.
· Familiarity with accessibility best practices.

About Lattice Lattice is on a mission to build cultures where employees and their companies thrive. In an age where innovation is happening all around us, there's commonality – people are driving these changes. We offer a solution that helps companies put employees first. Lattice is a people management tool that offers performance reviews, employee engagement surveys, real-time feedback, weekly check-ins, and goal setting in a way that allows companies to focus on employee development, growth, and engagement. Since launching in 2016 we have grown to over 1,800 customers globally, including brands like Slack, Reddit, Glossier, and Asana. About the team Lattice's Team builds products and services that supercharge other teams in delivering value to our customers. This includes work that expand the kinds of customers we can deliver value to (business types, business sizes, org structures, geography, and other factors) and work that leads to a more efficient team and holistic experience (Design System, data modeling, notifications, integrations, product patterns). As a result, this team and role is excellent for Designers who love breadth, collaborating across teams, and system thinking. Who you are You have 3+ years of professional experience designing experiences that empower the end user. You've collaborated with PM, Research, and Engineering to shape new opportunities. You care about why you're building something, not just what. You collaborate with cross-functional peers navigate the messy middle of the work, converging/diverging, assessing contraints and risk, and ultimately de-risking the ideal solution path. You over-invest in the visual and interaction portion of your work and consider yourself a craftsperson. You enjoy taking an active role in the development process. You collaborate with cross-functional peers to shape the experience roadmap for software projects. You have experience working with a broader Design team to identify opportunities to improve the utility, usability, and desirability of business-critical experiences. You have a growth mindset when it comes to increasing your own efficiency on planning, decision making, and pragmatic management of design debt. You're a great communicator and collaborator. You're clear and concise in explaining your thought process and in enumerating the tradeoffs made in your work. You develop strong and effective working relationships with Designers and cross-functional peers. You're proactive in seeking out mentorship, and are open and receptive to feedback. Your responsibilities You'll design software to help companies build cultures in which their employees thrive. You'll collaborate with Product, Research, Engineering, and Customer Success to help identify the needs of our customers, tirelessly iterate, and ship world-class solutions. You'll make contributions to our Design practices, identifying and evangelizing improvements to improve our team output. You'll embody our team values and design principles. You'll push our visual and interaction execution further. Lattice is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. Lattice is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

Who is Credible?

We believe life's changes create financial needs for people and that the traditional financial system often puts up unnecessary obstacles. People celebrate major milestones like going to college, getting married, and buying a home. And most of the time, these milestones come with financial implications.

At Credible, we have built a company with the mission of bringing transparency, choice, simple processes and savings to accessing credit for life's important moments. What you see is what you get. We are committed to being upfront, honest, and clear about your options. There are no mysteries, no hidden fees, and no secret clauses.

Credible is a fast-growing Fintech company that has world class management, has raised multiple rounds of funding, is generating significant revenue and is disrupting the lending market and helping people save money and get out of debt faster.

About the role

We are looking for an inspired, collaborative, creative Product Designer to join our team. You will craft the experience hundreds of thousands of users have while interacting with our product offerings. This role is not appropriate for someone solely focused on UX design - strength in visual/UI design is required to be successful in this role.

You will:
Design interactive, rich web and mobile app experiences
Drive end-to-end design projects to improve existing products and to develop new features
Participate in all aspects of the design process – ideation, market and user research, wireframing, prototyping and high fidelity design production
Produce pixel perfect design documentation for engineers to implement
Find simple and elegant solutions to complex user flows
Work effectively cross-functionally, with product, design, engineering, marketing and operations teams
Work in a dynamic start-up environment where opportunity for ownership and impact is significant
Be independent, reliable and respectful
Education and Experience:
2+ years of progressive experience in product design, web design, UI/UX design and/or art direction with a focus on web and mobile consumer products is preferred
Bachelor's degree in Web Design, Graphic Design, UI/UX, HCI or a related field or a degree with related coursework
A beautiful, inspiring portfolio that demonstrates real life experience with interaction models, customer flows, style guides, and prototypes for web and/or mobile products
Strong, demonstrated visual design aptitude – a great sense for color, form, typography and other design elements is shown in your work
Deep knowledge of design tools - Photoshop, Sketch, Illustrator, and any other tools needed to get the job done
Experience executing full cycle user research processes – everything from personas and ethnographic research to surveys, interviews and usability testing
Meticulous attention to detail and strong project management skills
Experience with HTML and CSS
Personality and Values:
Passion for creating exceptional user experiences that address real user needs
Strong problem solving skills with ability to simplify the complex
Thrive on collaboration with other teams to accomplish shared goals
Resourceful and mindful; you move fast but don't break things
Possess a build-measure-learn iterative mindset
Strong communication skills
Why work at Credible

We are a fast moving, fun-loving, seriously smart group of people who really care about impacting the lives of our customers. We empower our employees to make decisions, take risks, drive our business and make changes when we don't get it right. These are our values:
Exceed Customer Expectations: We provide an exceptional experience to each and every customer that compels them to share it with others.
Take Ownership: We are trusted to make decisions that are in the best interests of our customers and our business. We think and act like owners. We care – and that makes all the difference.
Be Curious: We are curious, ask questions, seek to understand and try new things.
Do the Right Thing: We earn trust by being transparent, respectful and honest with each person with whom we interact.
Get Results: Results fuel our excitement and we know how our personal accomplishments tie to the success of the company.
Be Bold: We are courageous and take risks that scare us. Our enthusiasm for experimenting is how we will find the next breakthrough.
Our benefits: We offer competitive compensation, generous benefits, free food and a flexible vacation policy.

But mainly, you want to work at Credible because you believe in our mission and want to have a major role in delivering on it! We look forward to getting to know you.

At Weights & Biases, our mission is to build the best developer tools for machine learning. We are hiring a designer to be an integral part of the product development process. You will work on a diverse set of problems in a fast-moving environment, designing product features and marketing collateral to delight our users and share our product with more people.

We love building powerful tools together, delighting our users, and supporting the inspiring work of machine learning researchers and engineers.
What you'll achieve
Develop empathy for users working in machine learning
Conduct interviews with academics and industry practitioners
Shadow users in their daily workflows, walking through common problems and pain points
Explore tactical and open-ended questions with our core base of active users
Build an intuition around what will make more users excited to try our product
Work through product problems, from defining opportunities to shipping features
Communicate your vision with mockups, flow charts, and interactive prototypes
Design and prototype multiple ideas quickly, in conversation with customers, to validate product decisions
Participate in design critiques and product feedback meetings
Balance great design with meeting short deadlines
Partner with developers as they build and ship features
Keep abreast of competitor products and industry trends
Craft and maintain beautiful assets for the Weights & Biases brand
Create marketing content, including landing pages and conference handouts, to showcase our tools
Mentor your peers in design thinking
About you
3+ years-experience in digital user-centered design, and are hands-on from the initial wireframes to developing prototypes and providing final assets
Proficient in user-centered design methods, storytelling, and detailed interaction design
Independently lead all aspects of the design process from ideation to deployment
Enjoy the fast-paced environment of a startup
Strong working knowledge of design and prototyping tools, such as Figma and Adobe Creative Suite
Proficiency in web-based technologies such as HTML and CSS
Strong critical thinking, decision making, and communication skills
About us
We have traction. Researchers at OpenAI, Toyota Research Institute, and other top-tier institutions use our product every day.
We have extensive experience working with companies to turn machine learning research projects into scalable, real-world deployments. We’ve watched hundreds of teams struggle to deploy machine learning models successfully, and the same problems show up repeatedly. Machine learning has created a fundamentally new kind of programming, requiring a fundamentally new set of developer tools. We created Weights & Biases to provide that missing toolkit.
We have an experienced founding team including the founders of Figure Eight, a successful startup in the machine learning space.
We care about diversity and are seeking people who love to learn and collaborate in an inclusive environment. AN ADE EXPERIENCE DESIGNER We are looking for a skilled Experience Designer who will help design interactive applications across a variety of platforms and form factors, to help meet our customers' needs. We are seeking an Experience Designer who has experience connecting customers and brands through intuitive interfaces and transformative brand experiences. Preference will be given to people who demonstrate a combination of strategic, conceptual and design chops. We believe that design starts with a strong business case and that our applications must provide both business and user value to be successful. We start with a strong UX and create stunning visual designs on top of them. We design and build to create reusable and scalable design systems for our clients that provide lasting value. A successful candidate should be an analytical and creative designer who is able to grasp user needs and solve problems. We will always prefer self-starters who can work closely with clients to understand how our designs help them meet their needs. APPLYING FOR A DESIGN JOBS AT ADE We get a lot of resumes for these positions and we look at each one. That being said we need some quick heuristics to help get through these, samples of design work/thinking samples are the best we have. Showing some portfolio, be it a personal website, dribbble, behance are all great resources for this. Even if you're a younger designer without much of a portfolio showing some of your sample or school work on dribbble is still beneficial for us and much more likely to make it through our HR filters. WHAT YOU DO: Analyze and meet product specifications and user expectations Perform concept and usability testing and gather feedback Use special personas based on user research results Create right interaction models and evaluate their success Build wireframes and prototypes around customer needs Solve UX problems, such as usability or findability, using a creative approach Collaborate with other designers to implement attractive designs Discuss design ideas and prototypes with developers Stay informed about competitor products and industry trends JOB REQUIREMENTS 2+ years' experience of working on a UX Designer, UI Designer or other relevant position Significant experience with design software and a solid portfolio of design projects Excellent knowledge of interaction design and information architecture Good knowledge of HTML/CSS; JavaScript is a plus Familiar with using modern design tools such as Sketch, Invision, Figma, and Zeplin. Experience with creating component design systems. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a business-oriented approach Strong communication skills

The Supply Chain and Ops Automation team is looking for an outstanding User Experience Designer for our enterprise experiences and internal tools that help power the Tesla business you see as a consumer. The UX Designer will be responsible for researching, designing, innovating, and prototyping new user experiences that help address the increasing challenges Tesla faces as we expand globally with new products and programs. Deliverables include user interviews, design mockups, experience flows, prototyping, design presentations, production of visual assets, process design and development, and follow up for proper implementation. The Supply Chain and Ops Automation Team focuses on the automation and tools that enable efficiency and scalability for our operational teams. The candidate will collaborate with business stakeholders, product managers, designers, and software engineers and will be a key contributor and originator in their own right. Candidates should possess exceptional user empathy, design skills, creative problem-solving, a great sense of aesthetics, as well as user-centered design principals. The applicant must have an affinity for minimal design, typography, and attention to the smallest of details. A strong ability to distill complex problems into simple, elegant solutions is key to success at Tesla. We are a fast-paced company with an entrepreneurial spirit, so the majority of the work will be focused on innovating original and creative content and application, as well as final deliverables and solutions that work in the real world. You will be working on the most advanced vehicle and energy solutions in existence both today and tomorrow. Responsibilities Research and define UX strategy for Supply Chain and Ops Automation. · Imagine, conceive of, manage, and drive Enterprise UX design projects from customer problem or opportunity to concept to implementation · Develop creative and innovative design solutions for enterprise tools and experiences that support multiple types of users in different types of roles with varying scope and objectives · Create and influence decisions that help implement an enterprise design language that is consistent throughout all internal tools and external customer facing experiences. · Identifies areas of opportunity and finds creative solutions that distinguish Tesla OS experiences from competition and position Tesla as the best sustainable energy company in the world · Ownership of digital experiences for large company initiatives · Constantly measure how designs are performing and iterate to improve those experiences. Influences team roadmaps to include experience improvements when the design or product is not performing or needs improvement. · Invest in building relationships and trust with stakeholders, peers and working groups. Build a strong network across Tesla, globally. · Determines best UX solutions based on customer feedback and business goals and helps to determine overall direction, identifying challenges and adapting as needed based on the context of the solution and customer. · Foster the defining and sharing of UX design patterns and standards, artifact reuse and consistency across team members. Contribute to the advocacy and adoption of the Tesla Design System for Enterprise. Requirements 3-5 years work experience advocating for, creating and building and world-class experiences for mobile, web, TV or other digital devices. Knowledge of global design best practices and working for international companies a plus. · An excellent portfolio showcasing UI/UX and visual design work with a strong design sensibility and articulate storytelling. Evidence of exceptional design ability is a must. · Must be proficient and highly skilled in Photoshop, Illustrator, Sketch and other design tools · Ability to prototype in Invision, Flinto, Framer or other prototyping tools. · Understanding of front-end web and mobile technologies such as CSS/HTML and general understanding of back end technologies that are required to build out experiences. Partnering well with technology is a must. · Ability to perform in a fast paced, high stress iterative design process under minimal supervision · Customer-focused, with experience using design research methods to uncover customer insights. Are able to take those insights and define the desired customer outcomes. · Evidence of solving large scale problems for customers. Ability to take complex concepts and simplify them for the customer in the form or elegant enterprise experiences. · Excellent command of enterprise user experience, design principles, problem-framing skills, and beautiful visual design skills. · Experienced at facilitation and collaborative problem-solving techniques to drive team alignment on charter and goals, ideation, experimentation, innovation and great user experiences. · Ability to define a user experience vision for enterprise businesses and inspire others to execute against that vision. · Outstanding written and verbal communication skills. Strong ability to communicate design concept ideas through sketches, prototypes and wireframes. Experienced and comfortable with presenting work to executives and large groups. Strong ability to communicate complicated concepts and bring clarity to stakeholders and team members. Employee Benefits As a full time Tesla employee you will receive full benefits from day 1 for you and your dependents. Our team is committed to enhancing physician and patient quality of life through Elation, a SaaS cloud-based clinical platform. We've built a product that users love, and we plan to keep it that way by continuing to empathize with users and help them overcome challenges.

The Design Team is looking for a Product Designer to join in our mission of deeply understanding our users and designing the right tools and experiences for them. Designing at Elation is humbling, challenging, and rewarding. Our users do work that affects human lives, and our tools can make or break that work.

As a Product Designer, you will ...
Partner closely with product managers and engineers to ship amazing user experiences
Understand a complex industry and user
Conduct user research to understand user problems
Devise simple, elegant solutions to complex problems
Drive ideation, gather stakeholder feedback, and perform user testing
Own and iterate UX, UI, and visual design and deliver thorough specs
Clarify, adapt, and ensure quality of designs as they are being implemented
Own key design initiatives that expand our capacity as a design team (e.g. improving our user research function, systematizing core knowledge about our user, improving design tools and process, etc.)
Design, build and manage style across the product. Expand the Elation design system and promote it across our products and teams to ensure a clear, efficient and consistent experience for our users.
Level up yourself and our team to be at the leading edge of design
Instill design thinking in our company's culture and communicate key insights about our users

3+ years of web-based product design experience, during which you've shipped your designs to production (and real end-users have interacted with them).

Experience conducting design research.
Excellent communication skills.

Company Description Square builds common business tools in unconventional ways so more people can start, run, and grow their businesses. When Square started, it was difficult and expensive (or just plain impossible) for some businesses to take credit cards. Square made credit card payments possible for all by turning a mobile phone into a credit card reader. Since then Square has been building an entire business toolkit of both hardware and software products including Square Capital, Square Terminal, Square Payroll, and more. We’re working to find new and better ways to help businesses succeed on their own terms—and we’re looking for people like you to help shape tomorrow at Square. Job Description **For consideration, please submit a link to your portfolio** We are looking for a Product Designer to join the Square Ecommerce team and work on Square Online. This position will require visual and UX skills for both web and mobile platforms, with an opportunity to drive impact for millions of small businesses around the world. Ecommerce is an essential part of Square's ecosystem, and you will work on challenges a business owner might face while getting started, setting up, launching, and managing all aspects of selling online. We believe in generalists at Square, and our Product Designers are expected to deliver high-quality UX and visual design. Daily responsibilities include: creating pixel perfect screens for complex product flows on web and mobile platforms, collaborating with other designers, reviewing built work with engineers and presenting work in design critiques and leadership reviews. This is a cross-functional role where you will work with other designers, product editors, analysts and engineers. You will: Create concepts and present them to your team to determine direction Work with other designers, receiving and providing feedback, and find ways to improve your work Build detailed product flows, including error states and edge cases Use data, research and customer insights in your work Determine your point of view of what success means for a given initiative Take on complicated projects and seek the information you need to move forward Qualifications You have: At least (2–4) years of professional design experience, including internships A portfolio that shows both visual and UX work you are directly responsible for that made it through to completion Experience speaking to the goals of the work as well as successes and failures Experience working on both web and mobile products Even better: You can work with your cross-functional team to determine goals and success of individual projects You can present your work to your product team and design peers You know when to compromise without sacrificing user experience or design principles You can produce pixel perfect designs by utilizing defined systems and frameworks You participate in research initiatives and brainstorms to gather input to improve your design work You seek feedback from other designers to help improve your work and grow your skills Additional Information At Square, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible. Perks At Square, we want you to be well and thrive. Our global benefits package includes: Healthcare coverage Retirement Plans Employee Stock Purchase Program Wellness perks Paid parental leave Paid time off Learning and Development resources

About the role

We are looking for experienced product designers to lead the creation of new products and the continual improvement of existing products. Our high-quality design and polished experiences are what set Envoy apart from our competitors, so we are looking for designers who can create industry-leading UI and UX across a suite of native mobile and web products.

This role requires strong UI design skills for web and mobile, and a passion for design quality and consistency.

Join a design organization of seven product and visual designers with a friendly, funny, low-ego culture and high standards for our design work, practices, and people. We value learning and growth and hire, diverse, well-rounded, communicative people.

You will
Lead the end-to-end design of complex, critical projects
Collaborate cross-functionally with product and engineering to build features that balance high design standards with technical, user, and business needs
Use qualitative and quantitative data to inform your design work, running user research and validating potential product changes
Contribute to the creation of design systems on web and mobile by creating Figma component libraries and partnering with engineering on the development of code component libraries
Help build the Envoy Design brand throughout the company and the wider design community by writing blogs, running events, sharing work on our team Dribbble account, and more
You have
5+ years of experience working as a product designer
Strong visual/UI design skills on web and native mobile, including layout, typography, visual hierarchy, and animation/motion
Strong user experience design skills: understanding of information architecture, multi-step and cross-platform flows
Strong product-thinking skills: understanding of how your designs support user goals, your team's goals, the broader product vision, and company objectives
Proven experience conducting qualitative and quantitative research to inform your design work
You are
Flexible: you enjoy taking on new challenges as new opportunities arise
Low-ego: you embrace getting constructive feedback on your work on a regular basis from a diverse group of designers, and you aim to foster psychological safety on your team
Someone with extremely high standards: you're practical and know perfect is the enemy of good, but you aspire for us to be great, and you care deeply about the quality of our work and our team
Insanely curious: before you even consider a solution, you want to understand and clearly articulate the problem, and when devising solutions, you seek and value input from as many sources as possible
A strong communicator: you can lead group design conversations, keeping them on-track and focused on delivering actionable next steps, and communicate complex ideas, goals, and problems in a way that is accessible even to those unfamiliar with the project

Code skills that enable you to build effective and accessible designs on web and mobile
You contribute to the larger design community through writing, speaking, mentoring, teaching, or more

We're looking for people who are driven by collaborative and creative environments to develop simple, innovative, and beautifully designed products that customers love to use. As the designer on our Text Experience team, you'll be responsible for reimagining how work gets captured and where work starts and ends in Asana. From the nuts and bolts of improving the text editing experience to transforming unstructured data into structured data and inviting collaboration, you'll create innovative solutions and drive a high impact roadmap. As part of a product-driven and design-led company, you will play a key role in a small team of Product Designers owning core product development, from inception to iteration and post-launch reflection. Asana is helping teams in 195 countries become significantly more productive with our leading work management platform. You will be designing beautiful experiences that make it as simple as possible for millions of users to adopt, use, and benefit from our product, helping us achieve our mission to enable all teams to work together effortlessly. Asana's Product Design team is a tight-knit, collaborative group of designers from many different backgrounds who love combining research, data insights, and peer feedback into a user-centered design process. We pride ourselves on having a high Designer to Engineer ratio that enables you to do your best work on a balanced team. What you'll achieve Own and lead the end-to-end design process of net new features and iterations of an award-winning product (read stories on the Asana Design blog) Work through product problems from opportunity and definition to shipping features to our customers Be actively involved in defining the strategy for your program team, as a key contributor to defining your program's goals, success metrics, roadmap, and sprint commitments Influence the direction of your program by identifying and defining new feature opportunities Deliver high-quality, polished, delightful, and easy to use design, thinking in terms of design systems, not just screens Design and prototype multiple ideas quickly, and connect regularly with customers to validate product directions Participate in design critique and present work regularly in product leadership feedback meetings Partner closely with engineers as they build and ship solutions Experience career growth and personal development with world-class mentorship and development programs About you 5+ years relevant design experience at a high tech, product-driven company Experience designing digital apps and systems; you have built product solutions from scratch and iterated on existing solutions Track record of innovating on new design patterns and features, ideally on a collaboration or communications product Clearly communicate design work with solid rationale informed by research and data A driven self-starter, experienced in taking ownership of the direction of ambiguous projects. Excited about collaborating and building relationships with other teams in the company, including Engineering, Marketing, UXR, and Product Management Possess a strong understanding of the product development process, from discovery and problem definition to detailed UX and visual design Creative problem-solver who can iterate with low-fidelity sketches of workflows and translate those into beautiful high-fidelity designs using Sketch and Figma Able to understand and adhere to a design system, and challenge and contribute to it when necessary Strong aptitude for building prototypes at various fidelity using tools like Framer, Flinto, Keynote, InVision, or HTML/CSS/JS Enjoy mentoring more junior team members, and leading by example to help other designers adopt best practices Approach problems with curiosity, and excitement to learn and grow your skills About us At Asana, we're building a better way to work, fueled by transparency, inclusion, and technology that is a force for positive change. Asana is a work management platform that helps teams orchestrate their work, from daily tasks to strategic initiatives, so they can move faster and accomplish more with less. For the past 5 years, we've been named a top workplace, including top 10 Great Place to Work Best Small & Medium Workplaces, #1 Fortune Best Workplaces in the Bay Area, #8 Fortune Best Workplaces for Women, and one of Ireland's Best Workplaces. With offices all over the world, we are always looking for curious, collaborative, and mission-driven people to help us enable the world's teams to work together effortlessly. We believe in supporting people to do their best work and thrive, and building a diverse, equitable, and inclusive company is core to our mission. Our goal is to ensure that Asana upholds an inclusive environment where all people feel that they are equally respected and valued, whether they are applying for an open position or working at the company. We welcome applicants of any educational background, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, citizenship, socioeconomic status, disability, and veteran status.

Mission

At Databricks, our mission as designers is to make data science simpler and more accessible so that more people can contribute to solving the world’s toughest problems. Product Designers at Databricks balance the creativity of a crafts person with the analytical curiosity of a data scientist. We believe in the traditional and timeless value of great graphic design - while at the same time, we have a restless desire to get to the truth and make the best decisions possible using data. We design simple and collaborative products that have the power to delight a discriminating and highly technical audience.

Outcomes

Gain a deep understanding of Databricks business objectives, users, market opportunities, and competition. Become well-versed on the Databricks product and its personas (Data scientists, data engineers, and administrators)
Deliver designs for Databricks’ product and contribute to the overall direction of the product
Lead system-wide and company-wide product design initiatives that can be measured and drive business results
Able to work closely with Engineering & Product Management, C-staff and other key leadership to drive critical initiatives through from ideation to completion
Actively seek & provide design feedback and collaboratively improve the design process

Competencies

Can execute beautiful visual and interaction work that’s rooted in a data-driven, and well researched UX process
A system thinker who has the vision to design the big picture, and the tactical ability to break it down so that engineering can succeed in building it incrementally
Ability to mentor junior to mid-level designers
Ability to moderate design thinking workshops and educate the organization on the value of design
A minimum of 10 years of product design work experience
Proven ability to lead large and complex design projects and balance the needs of diverse stakeholders
A designer with strong tradecraft, who is at ease drawing from a vast toolkit to get the job done
A natural communicator that thrives on collaboration with others who enjoys communicating their vision and thought processes
A storyteller who delivers insights about people and behavior – both verbally and visually, from qualitative and quantitative user research.
A bachelor's or master’s degree or equivalent, ideally with specialization in HCI, Interaction Design, graphic design, computer science, or related disciplines
A portfolio showcasing the end-to-end design process, from inception to production
Experience with the following is a nice-to-have:
Experience designing products in the Big Data space
Experience coding React, SQL, CSS, and/or Python
Experience building a design system

Benefits

Comprehensive health coverage including medical, dental, and vision
401(k) Plan
Equity awards
Flexible time off
Paid parental leave
Family Planning
Gym reimbursement
Annual personal development fund
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)

About Databricks

Databricks is the data and AI company. Founded by the original creators of Apache Spark™, Delta Lake and MLflow, Databricks simplifies data and AI so data teams can collaborate and innovate faster. More than five thousand organizations worldwide —including Shell, Conde Nast and Regeneron — rely on Databricks as a unified platform for massive-scale data engineering, collaborative data science, full-lifecycle machine learning and business analytics. Venture-backed and headquartered in San Francisco (with offices around the globe) Databricks is on a mission to help data teams solve the world’s toughest problems.

UX UX Designer At Redshift, UX Designers are part of cross-functional project teams, working with a Senior UX Designer, Visual Designer, User Researchers, Front-End Engineers, Producers, and company leaders. UX designers, consultants, project managers, and interactive producers are all potential candidates. This role reports to our Director of UX. Responsibilities Under the leadership of a Senior UX Designer, collaborate cross-functionally with other UX Designers, research, visual design, front-end engineering, producers, and company leaders to take products from concept to launch. Understand our clients' customers and users, and serve as their advocate when making design proposals. Generate design concepts, participate in design discussions and critiques, and collaborative sessions with teams and stakeholders. Prototype design flows and interactions with low-fidelity paper prototypes and clickable prototypes (using tools such as InVision and Pixate), and guide high-fidelity coded prototypes toward a high standard of excellence. Deliver detailed wireframes and user flows to agile development teams and refine as needed during project sprints. Participate in client meetings and presentations, and respond appropriately to feedback. Help plan and participate in user research and testing, and incorporate learnings back into designs. Contribute to a collaborative culture in maintaining openness to new or different ideas, seeking out and incorporating input from other team members, and making a creative contribution to other studio projects. Contribute to a positive, pleasant, and creative culture, and help ensure it is always fun to do business with Redshift. Candidates must have: Passion for user-centered design, and all things digital (web, mobile, desktop, social) Strong knowledge of the latest design and technology trends And understanding of user interface design processes and methodology across a variety of devices, and of how web and mobile apps are built A sophisticated sense of taste Ability to rapidly generate multiple design solutions, evaluate their strengths and weaknesses, and improve upon selected designs Ability to express yourself clearly and confidently Outstanding client management skills Experience managing a 3-5 person team of UX, Visual Design, researchers, and developers Great wireframing chops Proficiency with UX tools (e.g. InVision, Sketch, and the Adobe Creative Suite), as well as any other UX tools needed to get the job done 1-3+ years experience on a UX team in an agency environment Contributed to the launch of at least one web, mobile, and/or software applications Ability to take criticism and quickly apply feedback to designs Tolerance for working on-site in an open studio environment A sense of humor Plus at least 2-3 of these: Experience working with large consumer brands Excellent writing skills Visual design experience Technical experience (e.g. coding) Formal project management training Great Spotify library

About the company Turvo is the first multi-enterprise collaborative platform specifically designed for the global supply chain. Turvo connects people and organizations allowing shippers, logistics providers and carriers to digitally transform their workflows with cloud-based software and mobile applications for a better customer experience and brand differentiation. The technology unifies all systems, internal and external, providing one end-to-end platform to execute all operations and analytics, while eliminating redundant manual tasks and automating business processes. Turvo is based in the San Francisco Bay Area with offices in Dallas, Texas, and Hyderabad, India. About the Role We are searching for a Product Designer that will help build our product by solving complex challenges in simple, elegant ways. In this role, you’ll work with product managers, engineers, and other designers to bring clarity and ease of use to a complex ecosystem of products that offer businesses unparalleled visibility into their supply chain infrastructure. As part of the in-house Design team, you’ll actively help scale the group by suggesting structure and processes, including hiring, project management and studio life. This is a remote/virtual position based in the US. Preference will be given to candidates based in the San Francisco Bay Area or Cincinnati, OH. Duties & Responsibilities: Maintain a high bar of quality and consistency while working across a variety of product touch points Translate complex concepts and workflows into elegant solutions anyone can understand Use quantitative data and qualitative feedback to inform design decisions iteratively Build relationships and collaborate closely with cross-functional teams Verify and improve on designs through reviews, validations and testing with end users Actively practice and evangelize customer-centric thinking Inspire and educate teams on the design process Candidate Experience: 5 to 10 years experience designing for enterprise B2B platforms that extend across web and mobile An end-to-end design process that stretches from ideation to execution A portfolio showcasing multiple successfully launched products Demonstrated product thinking skills that prioritize outcomes over features Understanding of leveraging business goals while delivering a world-class user experience Ability to initiate and lead design discussions, with strong storytelling and presentation skills Comfort in a fast-paced, highly dynamic environment with multiple stakeholders Familiarity with the logistics industry is preferred, but not required. Perks & Benefits: Competitive salary Stock options 401K plan with matching Medical, dental, & vision insurance Unlimited PTO & paid holidays Flexible work hours We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and strive to make hiring decisions that reflect our commitment to diversity and inclusion.

About Imperfect

Imperfect Foods was founded in 2015 with a mission to reduce food waste and build a better food system for everyone. We offer imperfect (yet delicious) produce, affordable pantry items, and quality meat and dairy. We deliver them conveniently to our customers’ doorsteps and pride ourselves on offering up to a 30% discount compared to grocery store prices. Our customers can get the healthy, seasonal produce they want alongside the grocery staples they rely on, without having to compromise their budget or values. We’re proving that doing the right thing for the planet doesn’t have to cost more, and that shopping for quality ingredients can support the people and resources that it takes to grow our favorite foods.

We're headquartered in San Francisco with operations all over the country. Check our website to see if there is an Imperfect near you!

We're looking for folks who are positive, motivated, and ready to change the world. If that sounds like you, drop us a line!

How we are protecting employees from COVID-19

At Imperfect Foods, employee health and safety is our top priority. We have implemented processes and precautions to prevent the spread of COVID-19 in our facilities. We provide gloves, masks, and hand sanitizer to all essential employees who must report to work. Before entering our warehouse, employees have their temperatures checked. In addition, we take great care to ensure frequently touched surfaces are sanitized throughout the day and all warehouses are fully sanitized weekly.

We have also implemented an Emergency Sick Leave policy providing full-time and part-time employees 2 additional weeks of paid time off and up to 26 weeks paid leave if they have a confirmed case of COVID-19.

About the Role:

At Imperfect, our Product Design team exists to make grocery shopping a joy again. We imagine ways to take the chore out of meal planning, spend less time shopping, and get the most out of what we buy. We know that food means more than just ingredients: it’s the dish that transports us from where we are, a moment to connect with our loved ones, and comfort after a long day. It can also be a choice: to shop consciously for a better planet.

We are looking for a passionate, creative Product Designer to join our team and help turn our mission into a reality by designing end-to-end experiences for the 400,000 customers (and growing!) that use Imperfect. Your audience will be new and loyal shoppers - as well as the Merchandisers, Dispatchers, and Warehouse Operations who use the internal tools that drive various functions. We are a small but growing team, where you will have the unique opportunity to own design execution for a large part of the business as well as influence product strategy, process, and culture. You’ll work closely with Product, User Research, and Engineering to bring your ideas to life.
Responsibilities:
Work through product problems from definition and opportunity, to shipping features to end users
Design and prototype multiple ideas quickly, often with customers, to validate product directions.
Work within, and help grow, our Design System and Design Principles
Participate in weekly design critiques, and brainstorms with product leadership
Partner with engineers as they build and ship ideas
Skills and Qualifications:
3+ years of experience designing interfaces that have been used by thousands of customers
Deep understanding of the product development process, from definition to functional interaction and detailed visual design
Experience iterating from low-fidelity sketches and workflows to beautiful high-fidelity designs using tools like Figma
Ability to present ideas and rationale clearly, early and often in a way that invites collaboration and iteration
Bonus points:
Experience working on consumer product with offline components
Experience working with real-world logistics
Experience with illustration and drawing storyboards
About You:
Customer focused and research-driven
Curious, hardworking, and positive
You take action- you like ideas, but you like execution even better
Inclusive - you recognize the value of soliciting diverse perspectives
Hyper-organized - in your work and how you communicate
Personally aligned with our mission to eliminate food waste
Details of Position:
Position will report to the new Director of Product Design.
Based out of our warehouse-turned-office in the SF Bay Area.
Full-time, exempt position
Salary and employee stock options commensurate with experience
Competitive benefits package including health care, paid vacation, 401k, and free groceries!
Individuals seeking employment at Imperfect Foods are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.

U.S. E-Verify Notice: Imperfect Foods participates in E-Verify in the United States. Imperfect will provide the U.S. Social Security Administration (SSA) and, if necessary, the U.S. Department of Homeland Security (DHS), with information from each new employee's Form I-9 to confirm work authorization.

As the senior level designer you'll be part of a creative team developing an innovative and highly creative narrative based game on a major IP. You'll be responsible for developing the design vision, the gameplay mechanics and environment levels at all points in their creation. Starting from concept maps, grey box layouts, implementation, playtesting and iteration to final release. You'll work closely with the team leads to ensure that the gameplay, design and artistic visions are being met.*
Your responsibilities: *
*Create clear, concise, and visually oriented design materials that explain your design vision and specifies the needed requirements/features to achieve it. . *
*Use UE4 to build out well designed and functional white box layouts that also have great compositions and strong aesthetics.*
*Create immersive gameplay scenarios/environments that support and enhance the core mechanics of the game.*
*Work closely with both the art and narrative teams to deliver content that meets each disciplines goals and creates memorable experiences.*
*Responsible for conceptualizing and communicating and implementing engaging gameplay experiences and has the technical ability to carry out that vision.*
*Work closely with content programmers to help create design mechanics that yield compelling gameplay experiences. *
*Communicates design progress with the other creative leads. And welcomes collaborative feedback and iterations. *
*Help assess the progress, quality and user friendliness of the project via methods such as usability testing, focus tests and in-house play tests*
*Provides constructive feedback on all aspects of the product; find opportunities to increase the quality of the product and advise on how that information may be implemented, or held for future products*
Requirements for this role include: *
*Skill in UE4.*
*5+ years of design experience in a senior/lead role. *
*Serious passion for games, Console or PC.*
*Strong creative and technical design skills.*
*Ability to conceptualize and communicate an engaging gameplay experience *
*Self-motivated with the highest level of attention to detail.*
*Able to prioritize tasks well and meet deadlines consistently. *
*A thorough understanding of hardware limitations and how to design around them*
Job Types: Full-time, Contract

Pay: $35.00 - $50.00 per hour

Experience:
Design: 5 years (Required)

Likely

Yes

People-oriented -- enjoys interacting with people and working on group projects

Monday to Friday
No weekends
8 hour shift

Job Description

TuSimple is the self-driving technology company with a mission to bring automation to the trucking industry. The User Experience Design Team of Software Engineering plays a critical role in the mission. At TuSimple, the user experience design team is responsible for the user experience of software platforms that support the autonomous vehicle and related development work.

Example projects we are working on include:
A platform that displays critical vehicle information for test operators and developers
A platform for developers to regenerate the scenarios our vehicles met in the real-world
A Map editing platform for map producers to edit TuSimple HD map
What You'll Do:
Conduct user research, usability testing, and product analytics. Convert user demands into workable wireframes, concept designs, and prototypes
Develop both high & low fidelity mockups and interfaces that are clean, intuitive, and innovative
Utilize principle-based interaction design to generate and refine core concepts, interactions, and information design
Ability to leverage and balance business principles, stakeholders, and technical requirements while delivering user-centered design solutions
Establish a strong relationship with colleagues and partners, bringing them into the creative process and demonstrate the effectiveness and importance of good design
What You'll Bring:
Minimum of three years of UI and UX design experience for software/web applications with strong visual design skills
Bachelor's degree in Interaction Design, Graphic Design, Communication Arts, Information Design, or equivalent experience
Proficient with design and prototyping tools (i.e. Sketch, Illustrator, Photoshop, Invision)
Self-sufficient, able to manage workload to meet project deadlines. Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced environment and to make trade-offs when needed to optimize outcome when conditions change
Strong organizational skills and attention to detail
Preferred:
Experience with Enterprise B2B products
Experience with dashboards and data visualization

Want to work for one of the fastest growing and most admired companies in the world?

At Sisu, we're building a software platform that empowers people to make better decisions using data. Based on years of cutting-edge research at Stanford, the platform helps business understand why their key metrics are changing, in real-time, and using all their data.

We’re looking for a thoughtful, data-savvy, and product-focused designer to join our growing team. In this role, you’ll have the opportunity to drive the visual and interaction identity of Sisu, as well as design and launch a wide range of product experiences from concept to implementation. You’ll have a big impact on our customers, our overall business, and Sisu’s future growth. For a sense of how we like to work with each other and approach problems, check out Sisu’s values.
What you'll accomplish:
Refine and implement Sisu’s look and feel in the product
Design and ship business-critical, user-centric, data-oriented product experiences
Create storyboards, wireframes, and prototypes to communicate your ideas to the team
Work cross-functionally with product, engineering, and sales to identify and prioritize customer needs
Elevate design thinking and culture at Sisu, as part of our small, but growing design team

What you'll need to be successful:

A strong sense of design fundamentals, including iconography, typography, color, and data visualization
Creativity, persistence, and inquisitiveness about analytics, BI, and enterprise data, and the desire to help businesses solve problems in new ways
A track record of designing and building rich, accessible desktop experiences
Ability to design and iterate quickly and efficiently in a dynamic setting
Comfort tackling ambiguous problem spaces and ability to bring clarity through problem definition, scoping, and prioritization for design
Prior experience conducting customer research of any type and ability to synthesize qualitative feedback with data to guide design decisions
Experience teaming up with engineers and designers to build and ship products
Familiarity with design tools, such as Figma, Sketch, and Principle

Nice to have:

Prior experience building enterprise or data-oriented products
Prior experience with data visualization
For a product designer, there’s no better environment to advance your career, develop your skills, and make an impact along the way. As you mature in this role, you’ll have the chance to work with global leaders, learn from industry mavericks, and help build an amazing, eclectic, and supportive organization.

Sisu is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.

Everlaw is looking for a spirited Product Designer with superb attention to detail and a self-starter attitude. You will leverage your respect for users to drive design solutions end-to-end — from brainstorming the best experiences with the team to crafting pixel perfection right before shipping. You will also leverage data and feedback from users to iterate upon your designs and, ultimately, ensure an amazing user experience on our platform. Your work will matter — the experiences you design will help legal teams at law firms, corporations, government agencies, and nonprofit organizations, work more efficiently to discover truth and promote justice!

At Everlaw, our mission is to promote justice by illuminating truth. Our company culture is open and democratic and we’re committed to the professional growth of our team members, offering an annual learning and development stipend and regular check-ins with managers regarding career goals. If you’re looking for a place that values passion, integrity, thinking big, and a desire to learn, we’d love to hear from you! Think you’re missing some of the skills and are hesitant to apply? We do not believe in the ‘perfect’ candidate and encourage you to apply if you feel you can bring value to our team.

This is a full-time, exempt position located onsite in Oakland, California.
In your first few months, you will
Become product certified! You will learn the ins and outs of the Everlaw platform through a series of training modules
Collaborate with your team to conduct user research and synthesize results into insights that inform your designs
Create new functionality and enhance existing experiences for the platform by collaborating with designers, engineers, and product team members
Craft and deliver solutions that are intuitive and effective in the form of user flows, wireframes, prototypes, and pixel-perfect specs
Work closely with engineers to ensure an efficient implementation of your designs
Provide respectful, insightful, and actionable feedback to other designers to ensure an elegant and cohesive user experience
Contribute to the development of our design system and advocate consistent use of design standards across our product
Feel like part of the team! Our onboarding process will integrate you into the company with informative sessions on our policies, processes, and team structure and goals
Learn, grow, and contribute right away. We trust that you will bring experience and knowledge that will uplift the team, but we don’t expect you to know everything on Day 1. You will have time to develop your product knowledge and get up to speed on all aspects of Everlaw
In your first year, you will
Design the experiences of increasingly complex features with the big picture in mind while caring for the small details
Improve our design and product development processes by collaborating with the team and using your process-driven mindset
About you
You have a history of successfully launched product features that are user-centered and effective
You combine your exemplary design skills, critical thinking skills, and systems thinking to creatively craft solutions to complex problems
You highly value feedback and collaboration. You believe that good ideas can come from anywhere, that seeking feedback will make your designs better, and that developing features requires teamwork, careful coordination, and clear communication
You are a self-starter who is comfortable navigating ambiguity and driven to ensure your solutions are implemented efficiently
You are authorized to work in the United States. Please note that at this time, Everlaw is not sponsoring U.S. employment visas for any applicants
Pluses
More than 3 years designing experiences for SaaS products
You are familiar with the legal and ediscovery industries
You have experience building design systems
You have an aptitude for strategic product thinking that makes you a distinguished partner to the Product team
You have experience leading design sprints and workshops
Benefits
Competitive salary
Substantial equity 401k with company matching
Health, dental, and vision insurance
Flexible Spending Accounts for health and dependent care expenses
Fully paid pregnancy and bonding leaves for new parents (including adoptive and foster)
Seventeen paid vacation days plus ten bankable federal holidays
Annual allocation for Learning & Development opportunities and applicable professional membership dues
Company-sponsored life and disability insurance
Perks
Work in Downtown Oakland, just steps from the BART line and dozens of restaurants
Select your preference of hardware (Mac or PC) and customize your desk setup
Bond over team lunches and out-of-the-box events

#LI-RV1
About Everlaw

We help law firms, government agencies, and corporations sift through millions of documents of evidence in big lawsuits and investigations to find the proverbial smoking gun (or needle in the haystack -- pick your metaphor). It's a multi-billion dollar space typically dominated by service-oriented vendors, and we're coming at it with cutting-edge technology and elegant design. It's working, and we've been growing very rapidly: we host hundreds of terabytes of data and work with all 50 state Attorneys General and hundreds of law firms on some of the most high-profile cases litigated today.

If you’re looking for an open, democratic company culture that values passion, integrity, and a desire to learn, we want to hear from you.

Job Title: Senior Product Designer, Desktop — Rally Coach
Job Description:
About Rally Coach:

Rally Coach is focused on creating a digital platform to help members build healthy habits to reach their wellness goal, such as weight loss, nutrition, and other health condition management.

This is a unique opportunity to join a small design team responsible for creating multiple applications end-to-end. Working for Rally is the best of both worlds: it combines a startup mentality with an enterprise environment to create a dynamic design process that contributes to Rally Health's growing success. As part of the Experience Design Team, you will report to the Creative Director.

You Will:
Design desktop UX/UI for all products, features and value propositions
Work with XD / Product / Engineering Leadership to:
Ensure design sprints are in sync with strategy and timeline
Support QA through each release
Assess UX/UI performance in production
Take broad, conceptual ideas and turn them into wireframes and flow
Distill research and data into applicable insights
What We Look For:
10+ years of professional experience as a product designer, visual designer or similar role
Skills in UX/UI design and can explore experiences across multiple scenarios
High level of proficiency with Sketch, Figma, InVision or similar tools
Experience working with other designers, product managers and engineers
Experience working with requirements that evolve often
Experience ensuring final mockups are pixel perfect
Knowledge of HTML/CSS is a bonus
Experience creating or working with a design system is a bonus
Please note that hiring for this position will only be considered in the following states: CA, IL, MN, and DC
Rally Health™ is about putting health in the hands of the individual. With our easy-to-use online and mobile tools, we empower people by helping them take charge of their health and health care. Our culture is built on a belief of helping people live healthier lives, and we know that a diverse workforce enriches us with the talent, perspective and inspiration we need to achieve our mission. Rally knows that we are strongest when our teams reflect the diversity of the world around us, and when Rallyers can do their best work in a workplace where they feel a sense of belonging.

Great compensation package
Comprehensive benefits package for full-time employees, including medical, dental, vision coverage, stock purchase plan, and 401(k)
Wellness programs, including physical and mental health services
