About iRhythm:

iRhythm is a leading digital healthcare company focused on the way cardiac arrhythmias are clinically diagnosed by combining our wearable biosensing technology with powerful cloud-based data analytics and machine-learning capabilities. Our goal is to be the leading provider of first-line ambulatory ECG monitoring for patients at risk for arrhythmias. iRhythm's continuous ambulatory monitoring has already put over 2 million patients and their doctors on a shorter path to what they both need – answers.

iRhythm's User Experience (UX) Team

We work hard to bring beautifully crafted experiences in both form and function into the medical device space. Being part of the UX team at iRhythm means bringing the voice of our patients and healthcare professionals to the forefront of conversations about new initiatives and product features. This user-centric mindset frequently drives us out of the office and into the field to learn more about the challenges our users face and the broader context in which our products are used. We enjoy designing mobile apps, websites, hardware, and packaging that embrace these challenges – whether it's a doctor having a busy day at the hospital or an older adult patient applying a heart monitor at home.

About this role:

We are looking for an experienced Senior Product Designer who is passionate about improving people's lives through design and technology. In this role you'll work closely with a cross-functional team to craft and implement a product vision that shapes our end-to-end patient experience – from unboxing and applying our devices at home to engaging with our mobile and web apps. You will be at the center of our product development process leading the design of simple and delightful user experiences around highly complex data and hardware.

We are seeking someone who believes great isn't good enough, is a fierce advocate for the end user, and has the ability to concept big picture ideas as well as execute the fine details.

Responsibilities include:
Play an active role in setting the direction of the UX team
Contribute to cross-functional discussions about long-term product design strategy and vision
Work closely with Product Management, User Research, and Engineering to ensure projects are well-defined, high impact, and successfully executed
Lead, inspire, and mentor Product Designers to craft experiences that accomplish our business goals while remaining simple and intuitive for our end users
Partner with leaders on the team to create design systems and advocate for the consistent use of design standards across experiences
Collaborate with various Engineering teams to navigate development tradeoffs and ensure that designs are implemented as envisioned
Balance your time between leading design efforts and acting as a hands-on designer
About You:
Experience developing product design strategies
Experience creating and maintaining design systems
Experience motivating, mentoring, and leading Product Designers
Strong ability to solve complex user problems through innovative and simple designs
Strong understanding of visual design principles (layout, color, typography, etc.)
Excellent communicator, facilitator, and storyteller
A proven track record of shipping high-impact digital products
Minimum 8 years of experience with end-to-end product design across mobile and/or web platforms
Industrial design experience is a plus
Bachelor's/Master's in Interaction Design, or related field
Willing to travel occasionally to participate in user research (post-COVID restrictions
Additional Requirements
Resume
A portfolio that exhibits your creative and thoughtful approach to solving user interface challenges and your overall design process
What's in it for you:

This is a full-time position with competitive salary package and excellent benefits including medical, dental and vision insurance, paid holidays and paid time off.

IRhythm also provides additional benefits including 401K (w/ company match), an Employee Stock Purchase Plan, annual organizational/cultural committee events and more!

FLSA Status: Exempt

We welcome and celebrate people of all backgrounds, experiences, skills and perspectives. iRhythm Technologies, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer (M/F/V/D). About Lattice


Lattice is on a mission to build cultures where employees and their companies thrive. In an age where innovation is happening all around us, there's commonality people are driving these changes. We offer a solution that helps companies put employees first. Lattice is a people management tool that offers performance reviews, employee engagement surveys, real-time feedback, weekly check-ins, and goal setting in a way that allows companies to focus on employee development, growth, and engagement. Since launching in 2016 we have grown to over 1,800 customers globally, including brands like Slack, Reddit, Glossier, and Asana.

About the team


Lattice's Core Team builds products and services that supercharge other teams in delivering value to our customers. This includes work that expand the kinds of customers we can deliver value to (business types, business sizes, org structures, geography, and other factors) and work that leads to a more efficient team and holistic experience (Design System, data modeling, notifications, integrations, product patterns). As a result, this team and role is excellent for Designers who love breadth, collaborating across teams, and system thinking.

Who you are


You have 3+ years of professional experience designing experiences that empower the end user.
You've collaborated with PM, Research, and Engineering to shape new opportunities. You care about why you're building something, not just what.
You collaborate with cross-functional peers navigate the messy middle of the work, converging/diverging, assessing contraints and risk, and ultimately de-risking the ideal solution path.
You over-invest in the visual and interaction portion of your work and consider yourself a craftsperson.
You enjoy taking an active role in the development process.
You collaborate with cross-functional peers to shape the experience roadmap for software projects.
You have experience working with a broader Design team to identify opportunities to improve the utility, usability, and desirability of business-critical experiences.
You have a growth mindset when it comes to increasing your own efficiency on planning, decision making, and pragmatic management of design debt.
You're a great communicator and collaborator.
You're clear and concise in explaining your thought process and in enumerating the tradeoffs made in your work.
You develop strong and effective working relationships with Designers and cross-functional peers.
You're proactive in seeking out mentorship, and are open and receptive to feedback.
Your responsibilities
You'll design software to help companies build cultures in which their employees thrive.
You'll collaborate with Product, Research, Engineering, and Customer Success to help identify the needs of our customers, tirelessly iterate, and ship world-class solutions.
You'll make contributions to our Design practices, identifying and evangelizing improvements to improve our team output.
You'll embody our team values and design principles.
You'll push our visual and interaction execution further.

About Gap Inc.


Our brands bridge the gaps we see in the world. Old Navy democratizes style to ensure everyone has access to quality fashion at every price point. Athleta unleashes the potential of every woman, regardless of body size, age or ethnicity. Banana Republic believes in sustainable luxury for all. And Gap inspires the world to bring individuality to modern, responsibly made essentials.

This simple idea—that we all deserve to belong, and on our own terms—is core to who we are as a company and how we make decisions. Our teamis made up of thousands of people across the globe who take risks, think big, and do good for our customers, communities, and the planet. Ready to  learn fast, create with audacity and lead boldly? Join our team.

About the role


As a member of our User Experience Team @Gap you’ll experience and drive scale, impact and innovation. As one of the largest multi-branded global retailers, we’re amongst the handful of competitors who can – and must – be at the forefront of great digital experiences to thrive. We have a proprietary digital engine, integrated with a set of industry leading third parties, that helps drive a strong customer experience and is core to our customer strategy.

Gap, Inc. is looking for a UX Designer, Omni Experience. In this role, you will be a visual designer and skilled interaction professional. You will work with cross functional partners to improve the holistic omni user experience across Gap, Old Navy, Banana Republic, and Athleta.

You will work across multiple areas of UX, starting with designing new store applications for our store associates You should demonstrate strong interaction and visual design skills and be able to collaborate with a dynamic team across multiple touchpoints.

You will own specific touchpoints and process flows and help guide test and learn design sprints alongside other UX designers on your team. Additionally, you will facilitate communication between UX team members, Brand leaders, Store Operations, Store PDM team and technology partners to ensure an outstanding, holistic user experience is being taken into account.

What you'll do
Execute on a holistic end-to-end user experience vision across multiple platforms.
Develop conceptual diagrams, wireframes, visual mockups, click-throughs, and prototypes
Use business requirements, user research to assist in developing scenarios, use cases, and high-level requirements.
Anticipate evolving customer and store associate needs and how the organization can address them with current or new products/services.
Be a member of workshops and design sprints with project teams and stakeholders to explore problem spaces, identify new opportunities and create alignment.
Collaborate closely with Product Management teams to design user requirements and flows.
Take direction from Sr UX designers on the team, while furthering your own design and communication skills.
Who you are
You have a 2-4 years of professional UX Design experience.
You have a passion for retail and store experiences for both our associates and customers.
You live and breathe lean design methodology, design thinking and experimentation.
You think about design in your spare time and are naturally curious about better ways to do things.
You are visual and consider pixels your friend.
You enjoy systems thinking and service design.
You demonstrate that you deeply care for the craft and have an impeccable attention for details, while distilling the design components and patterns to compose a system.
You are looking to grow your career in a supportive organization and champion the user experience in everything you do.
Benefits at Gap Inc.
Merchandise discount for our brands: 50% off regular-priced merchandise at Gap, Banana Republic and Old Navy, 30% off at Outlet and 25% off at Athleta for all employees.
One of the most competitive Paid Time Off plans in the industry.*
Employees can take up to five “on the clock” hours each month to volunteer at a charity of their choice.*
Extensive 401(k) plan with company matching for contributions up to four percent of an employee’s base pay.*
Employee stock purchase plan.*
Medical, dental, vision and life insurance.*
See more of the benefits we offer.
*For eligible employees

Research Full-Time User Researcher As a member of the Redshift team you will work on multi-disciplinary teams and contribute to the development of simple, delightful and beautiful user-centered designs. You’ll collaborate with designers, strategists, and engineers to determine key questions, identify user needs, and deliver actionable insights. You’ll have the opportunity to inform design decisions and shape project outcomes in a fast-paced, consulting environment. You are responsible for running qualitative and quantitative research studies throughout the course of a project, including planning, execution, analysis and synthesis, and communicating findings. Depending on the nature of each project, studies may involve both generative, exploratory research such as ethnographic interviews as well as evaluative usability tests. The ideal candidate will have minimum 2 years experience across a range of research methodologies, with deep expertise in 1 or 2 areas. This role reports to our Director of Research & Strategy. This position is based in San Francisco. Responsibilities Plan, design, schedule and conduct in-person and remote, qualitative and/or quantitative user research studies Work with clients and research coordinator to draft screeners, develop consent forms and recruit participants Finalize research plans and protocols, write discussion guides, set up equipment and prepare for research sessions as necessary Analyze findings and deliver actionable insights; lead co-analysis and synthesis sessions with designers, engineers, and other team members Work with the Director of Research & Strategy to advise teams and clients on appropriate user research methods based on project goals, and help create and maintain project schedules Create, present and maintain project documentation including research plan, protocols, schedule, status and meeting reports, usability findings database and debrief reports Prepare research findings deliverables such as reports, presentations, video highlights, storyboards, use cases, personas, etc. as appropriate Establish and manage client relationships along with the rest of the project team Candidates must have: BA/BS or MA/MS in Human-Computer Interaction, Computer Science, Design, Psychology, Sociology, or related field At least 2 years experience across a range of research methodologies, with deep expertise in 1 or 2 areas Proven knowledge and experience with a wide variety of qualitative and quantitative research methods, with experience in applied research for product design (i.e. not solely academia) Excellent observational skills, analytical skills and critical thinking Strong oral and written communication skills Can work collaboratively and independently with minimal supervision Be willing to get creative with and experiment with alternative research methods Comfortable with ambiguity and love creative problem-solving Plus at least 2-3 of these: Experience working with or willingness to learn remote user testing tools Have experience designing and analyzing large-scale surveys Have a solid understanding of basic UX design principles or has worked in capacity of UX/UI/Product designer previously Up to speed in the latest design trends on both web and mobile Strong project management, documentation and organization skills

OVERVIEW

Every year, people across the world spend nearly one trillion dollars on groceries. It's an industry that's been around for centuries. Food itself, however, has been a constant in people's lives since the beginning of time. Yes, sustenance is essential, but it's also much more than that. Food can be a part of a daily ritual or a special moment that resonates with people on a meaningful and emotional level. It can be a much-needed break in a long day, a taste that brings back memories, a creative experiment, a shared meal with loved ones, or even comfort during a hard time. Whether it's a special occasion or an everyday occurrence, it should always be easy for people to get the ingredients they need.

The Instacart Design Team is dedicated to making grocery shopping effortless for everyone and finding solutions to large-scale challenges that will forever change the way people feed themselves and their loved ones.

ABOUT THE JOB

We're seeking creative problem solvers that can untangle complex problems and deliver polished, delightful products for our customers, shoppers, and retailers. You'll use your full range of skills including strategic design, interaction design, and visual design to solve problems and craft amazing experiences. You'll partner with research, product, data science, engineering, and content strategy to identify new opportunities, create and test concepts, and deliver end-to-end solutions that are functional, usable, and totally lovable.

ABOUT YOU
5+ years of experience as a product designer/UX designer in a relevant industry
Fluency in the latest product design trend, tools and technology cross platform
You love fast-paced environments
You are curious, and willing to go above and beyond the job description
You are a generalist who can drive the design process end to end
You are detail-oriented while being able to see the big picture
You make a great thought partner with the cross-functional teams
You are an excellent storyteller and communicator
You exude can-do attitude and enthusiasm
You are self-aware and humble
Strong portfolio showcasing the problem solving skill and high design caliber; you MUST provide a link to your portfolio (and password if applicable) to be considered for this role

Academia.edu is hiring a Product Designer (mid-level or Senior)
Academia.edu is profitable and growing, despite the challenges of the COVID-19 pandemic. We have a goal of making a bigger impact on the world, and we’re looking for a remarkable Product Designer to help achieve this goal.
Life is short. Do something that matters
Join a company where what you work on changes the world for the better. As a Product Designer, you’ll be designing the next generation of our premium product offerings that help academics and researchers be more successful in their jobs.
About Academia.edu
Our mission is to accelerate the world's research. This increases the velocity of scientific achievement in every field, resulting in a positive social impact on humanity.
Our repository of academic papers enables everyone in the world to read scientific research papers uploaded to Academia for free. The platform also provides the means for professors, scientists, and researchers to collaborate on their fields of interest. We are proud to share that we have over 142 Million registered users and that number is growing by 3-4 Million a month.
Our business model is a premium subscription service. The success of our subscription premium products is critical to funding our mission to accelerate the world’s research. We have over 250,000 premium users.
We are a small team of ~58 employees with 4 designers and ~30 engineers. Our current plans call for us to launch several new products and still be self-sufficient and profitable this year. All this during some of the most challenging times in the past 100 years!
What you’ll do
* Design experiences that deliver value to our customers. You’ll solve customer problems that drive business results.
* Launch multiple A/B tests and measure their performance. You’ll then iterate on your designs and launch new tests based on what you learn from your previous tests.
* Integrate user research findings into your designs. You’ll collaborate closely with user researchers to better understand user needs and goals.
* Be an active member of the Design Team. You’ll give and solicit feedback from other designers in order to continually raise our bar for quality.
* Work closely with PMs, Engineers, and C-level Executives. You will be a full-stack "embedded" designer working closely with a dedicated PM, engineering lead, and ~5 engineers.
About you
* 3-5 years of hands-on experience in product design.
* Good visual design skills.
* A strong background in UX.
* A portfolio (online or PDF) that demonstrates your experience, success, and creativity in your projects.
A few notes:
* You must be willing to work out of our San Francisco office when safe to do so until then it will be remote.
* This role reports to Academia's Design Manager, and is part of the broader Product, Design, and Research team led by Academia's Chief Operating Officer.
Nice to have
* Experience in a test-driven environment (A/B testing and results analysis).
* Experience in producing designs that improve conversion rates or marketing experiences.
* Expertise in producing beautiful and performant visual designs.
* Experience building new consumer product offerings, and conducting user research to inform MVP definition and development.
* Experience leading discussions with PMs, engineering, other designers, and execs in evolving design proposals.
* Expertise in considering the technical difficulty of different designs, and in finding ways to test concepts as simply as possible.
* Expertise in communicating the value of our product offerings in a way that consumers want to pay for them.
* Experience with subscription products.
Benefits & perks
* Compensation & Benefits: Competitive salary, stock options, Flexible Spending Account (FSA) & DCA, & a 401k.
* Health & Self-Care: Paid medical, dental, & vision insurance for employees & their dependents. Flexible sick days, flexible hours, four weeks + 1 day (21 days) paid vacation, 11 holiday days, and paid parental leave. Standing desks.
* Convenience & Location: Catered lunches served daily, snacks & drinks. On-site showers & bike storage. The office is located just a short walk to public transportation.
* Learning & Development: Budget for professional development, team building, and events. Free books.
* Fun & Activities: Chess, foosball, piano, guitar, board games, juggling. Company retreat every summer. Weekly bootcamp with our personal trainer.
Before Covid-19 we had these cool activities, but now we’re all sheltering in place many of these activities are still done remotely and we have others in the works.
* Paid Sabbatical: Six weeks of fully-paid sabbatical leave for every four years you work here.
Diversity and Inclusion
Academia is a proud equal opportunity employer and we are committed to hiring and supporting a diverse workforce. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

*Please note that our thredUP team is currently working remotely, however, this role will be expected to report to our Oakland location once we are safely able to return to the office.

About thredUP

In 2009, thredUP set out to make used clothes the new normal and create a more sustainable future for fashion. The company designed a modern resale experience that took the work and risk out of thrift, and converted a generation of secondhand skeptics to fans. Sellers send clothes directly to thredUP by the bagful, and buyers shop quality-checked items from over 35,000 brands at steep discounts. To power this marketplace, thredUP built an infrastructure that has recirculated 100 million unique garments via proprietary technology, data and logistics. thredUP most recently expanded its platform with Resale-as-a-Service (RaaS) to power resale for the world’s leading fashion brands. As a circular fashion pioneer, thredUP is reducing fashion’s impact on the planet and unlocking economic value for consumers and brands alike.

About the role
thredUP has spent the past 10 years solving the complex problems required to build technology and marketplace platforms, operational infrastructure, and a vibrant brand that serves our customers and can inspire a new generation of consumers to think secondhand first.

As the secondhand market is set to soar and consumers are more switched on than ever about the impact of fashion waste on the planet, we have an amazing opportunity to power the $50B resale economy as a leader in the space and to usher in a more sustainable fashion future. We have already served millions of customers and have redistributed over 100 million unique garments from closets across America, and we’re just getting started!

Ultimately, our customers are at the core of our business. Our ability to develop a successful longer-term strategy rests on the depth of our understanding of our customers’ contexts and needs as we evolve. As a UX researcher, you will act as a liaison between design, product, brand, marketing, customer support, data science, and other stakeholders. This is a hands-on role talking and interacting with users to generate actionable insights and recommendations, working to scale research competencies within our design, product, and other stakeholder teams, and advocating for our customers’ voices and needs within thredUP.

ThredUP has a collaborative, supportive, and transparent culture and we are invested in the growth of the people who join our team. We look for people who are motivated to learn from others and to help each other grow, people who are open to new ideas and ways of doing things, and people who want to experiment their way forward.
If you’re not sure that you’re 100% qualified, but are up for the challenge - we want you to apply.
Relevant experience...
User research experience, in applied research or product research settings (either end-to-end, usability, or generative research) and/or in academic settings, with examples of actionable research outcomes
Experience taking broad or ambiguous topic areas and translating these into concrete research projects
Experience designing, structuring, and conducting research projects on new and unfamiliar topic areas
Experience designing, differentiating, and prioritizing different research methods (e.g. interviews, surveys, usability studies, or others) given different research goals, questions, and available resources
Experience advocating for and communicating research findings to diverse audiences through both written and in-person formats and presentations
What you’ll be working on...
Collecting, analyzing, and synthesizing user insights from a variety of data sources (e.g. could include interviews, surveys, focus groups, or other methods)
Partnering with Product and other stakeholders to translate UX learnings into insights that inform and generate business impacts in areas such as product design, development, marketing, or business strategy
Building narratives to frame and distill complex problems and findings, and communicating and championing these user insights with various stakeholders.
Continually advocating for user perspectives.Collaborating with and soliciting inputs from various stakeholders, in order to incorporate technical and business requirements into research and to uncover areas where UX can have outsized impact
Driving the growth of thredUP’s UX program: collaborating to scale the research competencies across our teams, and continually making our UX processes more efficient so that more teams across thredUP can incorporate impactful, high-quality user insights more quickly, often, and effectively to drive decision-making
What We Offer:

The opportunity to make a massive impact & influence outcomes for our business and customers alongside passionate coworkers
Autonomy. The ability to make, own, and carry out decisions
Competitive salary, equity and full benefits (health/dental/vision insurance & 401k)
Work from anywhere most Tuesdays and Thursdays (what we call Maker Days)
Catered lunch on Wednesdays, cold brew coffee and beer on tap
Flexible PTO

At thredUP, our mission has been built on extending the lives of millions of unique clothing items. Much like our inventory, we believe diversity is key. As a diverse and inclusive workplace, we are committed to ensuring our employees are comfortable bringing their authentic selves to work every day. A unique perspective is critical to solving complex problems and inspiring a new generation to think secondhand first. Everyone is welcome - be you.

Why is this role important?


PresenceLearning's mission is to unlock the full potential of students, therapists, and special education leaders. We believe that people deserve a better experience when using special education software. We are looking for a smart, collaborative, inquisitive designer who is seeking an opportunity to delight our users in the often-overlooked segment of special education.

As a Product Designer, you'll be responsible for assisting in the creation of interaction flows, from concept to iterative improvements, ensuring that our designs balance needs among our stakeholders, technology, and business. This role is on a small, high performing team responsible for developing best-in-class products at the bleeding edge of live online speech, occupational, and mental health services for K12 students. The person in this role will work very closely with our designers, product managers, and engineers to design, develop, and ship amazing products.

What will you do at PresenceLearning?
Design a tablet version of our therapy platform so a child can fit in an extra speech therapy session on the ride home from school after his parents pick him up
Create annotated wireframes, specs, and assets for a collaborative YouTube video viewing system within our therapy platform that behavioral health professionals can use to teach social skills to children with autism
Do a deep dive on the experience of parents with erratic schedules who need to create recurring appointments and gather requirements for a new type of mobile scheduling system
Pair up with a developer to rapid prototype a new user flow for entrepreneurial clinicians to craft their offering on our marketplace
Develop UX documentation (personas, experience maps, etc.) for parents who are looking for the right clinician after discovering their child has special needs
Conduct a contextual inquiry study to learn how therapy therapists utilize advanced video modes in our therapy platform
What are we looking for?
Minimum 4 years of design experience with proficiency in creating wireframes and detailed mock ups
Familiarity with Figma and Photoshop
Comfortable working with pre-established component libraries for consistent design
Understanding of user-centered design philosophy, process, and deliverables
Experience in creating developer-ready interfaces, flows, and documentation with supporting assets, specs, and annotations
Exceptional portfolio of shipped products
What will help you succeed here?
You consider yourself primarily a "full-stack" designer who is comfortable working across the full range of the designer problem-solution space including but not limited to general problem-solving, UI Design, UX Design, Interaction Design, UX Research along with bonus points for writing code
Strong communication, interpersonal skills, ability to work with remote teams
You are a team player who is excited to collaborate with engineers, product managers, and other designers in a fast-paced development environment
You're excited at the prospect of contributing to product vision and strategy
Experience making design decisions using the full spectrum of available data gut instinct, qualitative, quantitative, and analytics and the judgment to weight the data sources depending on the context and application
You love to make things that improve people's lives at the intersection of education and healthcare
Where is this position located?
This position reports to our Director of Product Design in San Francisco.
PresenceLearning has offices in New York, Salt Lake City, and San Francisco.
We support remote work from other locations provided you are able to travel to our core locations as needed.
All employees are currently working from home during Covid-19.

At Plaid, we're convinced that the way people interact with their finances will drastically improve in the next few years. We’re dedicated to empowering this transformation by building the tools and experiences that thousands of developers use to create their own products. About our team The design team at Plaid is made up of service designers, interaction designers, writers, visual designers and researchers who work hand in hand with our peers in marketing, product management and engineering to create Plaid’s market defining products. What you’ll do here We’re looking for an experienced product designer to join our Emerging Products team. Here you will spend time working with both Plaid customers and end users to understand their needs and convert research insights into world class experiences. You will be helping Plaid bring to life new products at the edge of the fintech ecosystem. What excites you Giving people more control over their financial lives A fast-paced, product-minded culture that moves rapidly from planning and executing user research, to prototyping and testing ux recommendations Working with our user facing financial product, helping optimize it in places and expand it in others, to meet the needs of our new end-user facing use cases Closely collaborating with engineering, product management, and business teams on strategy, from definition to execution Contributing to our design culture through collaboration, presenting work, and sharing feedback Working with our Design Systems team to bring uniformity across all our products and platforms What excites us Being a tireless advocate for users and user-centered processes A diverse portfolio demonstrating strong product design sensibilities and experience in: conducting user research, defining customer journeys, prototyping with users, and drawing insights An avid story-teller, skilled in effectively communicating their process and design decisions with an understanding for business impact A senior level designer with experience creating and shipping software An appetite for interdisciplinary collaboration and experience working on fast-paced emerging product teams Ability to communicate and contribute ideas across all levels of design Proficiency with industry standard tools for prototyping and visualizing your ideas Relevant experience in the Financial Technology industry or with Payment related products is a plus We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We Breathe Life Into Data!

At Komodo Health, our mission is to reduce the global burden of disease. Smarter use of data is essential to this mission. We combine the world's most comprehensive view of patient encounters with innovative algorithms and decades of clinical expertise to power our Healthcare Map, the industry's most precise view of the U.S. healthcare system. With the Healthcare Map as our foundation, we offer a suite of powerful software applications that deliver exceptional value to the industry.

Our people are the center of our success. We are a smart, supportive team with diverse perspectives and a shared passion for fixing what's broken in healthcare. It's fun, challenging and important. Join us!

The Opportunity at Komodo Health

The mission of Komodo's Product Designer is to join a small group of individuals that sit as a centralized group in our product portfolio. This role will own the end to end user experience for a product and drive big impact delivering new features that meaningfully enhance people's lives and help get us closer to our revenue goals.

Looking back in your first 12 months at Komodo, you will have...
Led and owned the end the end of designing multiple high impact features, including conducting the research required to drive towards the best design solution
Quickly on-boarded to the team
Created user-centered designs by considering target audience, user workflows, metrics and research
Contributed to the brand experience by upleveling our brand visuals in the product
Developed innovative concepts, outside of the box wireframes, click-throughs and prototypes
Developed design specifications and design patterns for the engineering team
Presented design work to the Eng team, company leadership for review and feedback
Collaborated with Marketing and Sales teams to gather customer feedback, facilitate research and fold it back into our products
What you bring to Komodo:
Experience or the desire to jump into a small team and work scrappily to "get things done"
Mastery of design tools that the team uses to date, such as Sketch, Invision, Zeplin, Lucidchart, Principle
Mastery of creating iterative designs easy to scale
Empathy and extreme understanding of healthcare market segments and our target users
Proficiency in design best practices, ability to bring to the table new design trends
Humble expert mindset with a strong mindset towards taking something from conception all the way through implementation
Comfort collaborating and being a design advocate with leadership and other counterparts
Curiosity piqued? Learn more about us!
Cholangiocarcinoma Foundation & Komodo Health partner to fight cancer
Komodo Health's 'Meet a Dragon' series
Komodo Health's $50M Series C funding led by Andreessen Horowitz, Joined by Oak HC/FT
Komodo's Values that Drive our Culture
In Conversation with Dr. Arif Nathoo, Komodo Health's CEO

Posted: Oct 14, 2020
Weekly Hours: 40
Role Number:
200173562
Marcom is Apple’s Global Marketing Communications group. We lead all of Apple’s advertising and marketing to ensure the flawless development and execution of world-class communications.

In this role, you will work with a team of designers, writers, and technologists to articulate the user experience (UX) for customers across a multitude of Apple's digital touchpoints. These include apple.com, the Apple Store app, social media platforms, and digital signage.
Key Qualifications
You have at least 4 years of significant experience in User Experience Design.
You have validated conceptual and analytical skills
You are focused, keep a level head and work well within a collaborate team.
You have proven success in strategic and design thinking, and validated expertise in content strategy, system design, usability, analytics, user testing, information architecture, and marketing.
You possess strong oral, written and social skills to articulately express the rationale behind design decisions.
Your capabilities engender confidence that assignments are on track and on strategy.
You can present and articulate the vision in a purposeful and thoughtful way and your design sensibility and keen eye for aesthetics are unparalleled.
You have extensive experience with content strategy and platform design, from large-scale marketing sites to transactional commerce sites.
You have excellent web and app design experience and are proficient in development technologies.
You understand the requirements of the process, including typical time and resources needed is to produce extraordinary work.
You are fluent in analytics, usability tests, and other forms of qualitative and quantitative feedback.
You have an eye for detail and an excellent sense of aesthetics and functionality.
You have a dream of working in a creative and dynamic environment.
Description
- Presents work to internal teams and leaders at Apple, clearly articulating design rationale.
Collaborates within the UX team by working reciprocally and sharing standard methodologies.
Produces clear UX documentation for marketing sites, transactional flows and app experiences. These include sitemaps, wireframes and prototypes.
Iterates rapidly as ideas emerge and priorities change to meet the needs of the project.
Demonstrates the ability to use analytics and user testing to inform the creative process.
Provides UX direction to a broad audience, and contributes at a high level during all phases of an interactive project.
Manages and builds positive relationships across disciplines with writers, designers, developers, and creative technologists.
Brings ideas to the table and collaborates effectively with copywriters, art directors, developers and cross functional teams to develop clear proposals for UX solutions.
Education & Experience
Bachelor Degree with multidisciplinary educational backgrounds such as Psychology, Computer Science, Information Sciences, commerce/business Library Science, Human Computer Interaction or other related discipline preferred.

Portfolio shows applied knowledge of usability, user-centered design, and content strategy. Your UX documents include site maps, flows, and wireframes and strong capacity for both logical and creative thinking. Your work shows attention to detail in every aspect.

Risk Management Solutions, Inc. is recruiting for our Newark, CA office: Product Designer

Partner with engineering, product management, and business leaders to build delightful experiences for the software products customers. Meet with stakeholders (PMs, engineers, AppX leaders, customers) to identify product roadmap and requirements. Articulate the design vision and strategy while overseeing the user experience and instilling design thinking into the product development lifecycle. Visualize, prototype, explore multiple product directions, and validate hypotheses - understanding the business and technical impact of directions. Drive design and technical goals and shape the visual design language for the user experience across the application suite. Create, manage, and complete tasks in online collaboration tool (e.g. JIRA), and maintain a constant flow of work. Summarize and document learnings in end-to-end user flows, diagrams, documents & spreadsheets. Create high fidelity designs, meeting UX best practices and Design Standards. Actively seek inputs and feedback from designers, product managers and customers to improve designs and ensure they are consistent with existing design standards and solve for customer needs. Perform design validation with engineering teams to ensure designs are implemented up to specification, without bugs or any deficiencies.

Education and Experience Required:

• Master’s degree or foreign equivalent in Human Computer Interaction or related field and 24 months of experience.

Job code #40707 must be referenced when applying to this position.

About RMS

There’s a 1% chance an earthquake will cause $50 billion of insured loss within the next 12 months and a 5% chance that a hurricane will cause $60 billion of insured losses next year. At RMS, we turn risks into real numbers. How? By building simulation models that allow insurers and investors to understand and manage their global risks--from hurricanes, quakes, and wildfires, to cyberattacks, terror attacks, and pandemics. Why? We want to build a more resilient world, and we’re on a mission to help make every risk known.

Insurers, reinsurers, investors, financial institutions, governments, and NGOs trust RMS solutions to better understand and manage catastrophe risks. RMS was founded in 1989 by Stanford scientists who created our first model for California Earthquake. Today, RMS has some 1,300 employees across 13 offices in the US, London, Bermuda, Zurich, India, China, Japan, Singapore, and Australia, and over 1,000 products and models now covering six continents.

RMS helped pioneer the natural catastrophe model market we now lead – and we continue to innovate. In May 2019, we announced RMS Risk Intelligence™ (RI), an open-standard platform for strategic risk management. Through this purpose-built platform, clients can tap into RMS HD models, rich data layers, intuitive applications and APIs that simply integrate into existing enterprise systems to support business decisions across underwriting, risk selection, mitigation, and portfolio management.

How we understand and manage risk affects everyone and our passion is nothing less than creating a more resilient world through a better understanding of catastrophic events. Join our team of leading scientists, developers, industry experts, and world-class professionals. Together, RMSers make a difference on a truly global scale.

Visit RMS.com to learn more and follow us on LinkedIn and Twitter.

RMS is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunity without regard to race, color, creed, gender, religion, marital status, registered domestic partner status, age, national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic characteristics, sexual orientation, or any other classification protected by applicable local, state, or federal law.

To all recruitment agencies: RMS does not accept unsolicited agency resumes and will not be responsible for the payment of placement fees related to unsolicited resumes submitted to open positions, job aliases, or to our employees.

In 1954, in Columbus, Indiana, Eero Saarinen designed a bank with glass walls, no offices, and a completely open floor plan. It was surrounded by trees; the furniture was made by Herman Miller; the lobby flooring was thick, rustic brick. The bank was built with transparency and community at its core. Since 1954, a lot of things have happened — Saarinen’s bank branch is now a conference center, people increasingly live on the internet, and it’s hard to think of a single bank that still applies design thinking to their product. Mercury is building a bank for startups. We believe building a bank in 2020 revolves around thoughtful design, and we’re looking to add a product designer to our team to help. You’ll: Take ownership of large portions of a complex product Work across the entire design stack, including: speccing projects; designing workflows, detailed interactions, and high-fidelity visuals; and ensuring quality implementation Find elegant solutions to user problems, and think critically from the user perspective Simplify and cull design elements with a ruthless eye Craft designs from first principles (referencing existing solutions is often a poor idea in banking) Imbue mundane tasks and flows with a feeling of wonder Prototype multiple visual and UX concepts and then narrow them to the right solution Explain and debate the reasoning behind your product decisions Work directly with 2–4 engineers, the business team, a product designer, and a visual designer You should: Have the ability to design whole systems, not just interface elements or static pages Have experience and interest in the entire design stack, including UI/UX, visual design, and interaction design Have experience building for a variety of form factors, including mobile Understand when no design is the best design Have a strong personal design aesthetic and also understand the Mercury aesthetic Want to create elegant, calm designs that predict and exceed users’ expectations Feel comfortable anticipating and designing for edge cases Understand the balance between perfect design and getting to market Exhibit kindness and humility in everyday interactions

Join us as we pursue our disruptive new vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. We are a company filled with people who are enthusiastic about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers. At Splunk, were committed to our work, customers, having fun and most importantly to each others success. Learn more about Splunk careers and how you can become a part of our journey!

Role:


Splunk is looking for a highly motivated Web UI Designer to join our Brand+Creative Web Studio. As a Web UI Designer you will contribute to the design of our web and brand presence on Splunk.com and other public facing websites. This role requires a high-level of collaboration with the web and content marketing teams and subject-matter experts across several groups across the business to deliver a highly engaging site.

You will have a hands-on background managing, producing and optimizing efforts with a roll-up-your-sleeves work ethic and real passion for all aspects of web design. You are able to understand high-level systemic project requirements and apply web, UI, design and brand expertise to achieve strategic goals. If you are ready to join a rapidly growing team in a highly creative and impactful role, we want to talk to you.

This role is a contract position focused on web design and not app design. The position reports into the Senior Manager | Web Studio and is 40 hours a week remote, based out of the San Francisco HQ location.

Responsibilities:
Participate in concept development, ideation and visual designs for prototypes and mockups.
Design prototypes, responsive UI Design layouts, build imagery and interactive assets that address the business and brand requirements, including design and production of screen layouts.
Deliver solid redlines for dev team to execute and contribute to our Design system.
You will be integral to collaborating with the marketing department to refine the user experience while working closely with web UX, web publishers and web developers for delivery.
Help establish and regularly report on metrics to measure success and to continuously improve design deliverables.
Participate in the development and maintenance of our Design system.
Stay up-to-date with the latest web design trends and technologies.
Requirements:

Current online Portfolio - which highlights a shown grasp of web design principles.
You are enthusiastic about responsive web design, user experience and web development and can bring new and innovative ideas to improve the web presence.
3-4 years (Mid -Level) or 5+ Years (Senior-level) of professional experience in a dynamic start-up environment or in-house with one of the big name companies in the Bay Area (Salesforce, Google, Apple, Oracle etc.), or with an interactive agency.
Self-starter that loves to get things done and is committed to constant learning.
You enjoy cross-functional collaboration with multiple teams to achieve a consensus on design and are comfortable working in a fast paced company with the ability to take on different projects while maintaining calm under pressure.
Excellent communicator across different mediums and a variety of multi-functional teams.
Expert knowledge of UI design standard methodologies and web production techniques.
Shown experience originating new concepts and innovative design approaches for web which have significant impact on marketing efforts.
Proficient in MSOffice suite: Word, Excel, PowerPoint.
Proficient in G Suite: Docs, Sheets, Slides.
Advanced knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite and Figma (or similar UI design software) required.
Proficient in web technologies including HTML5, CSS3, Javascript and frameworks such as Bootstrap. Through understanding of web technology and comfort with light front end coding required.
Motion graphics and video for Web, interactive prototyping and/or illustration experience a plus.
Education:

BA or MA in Graphic Design, Communication Design, Information Design, Digital Media Design or other Visual Design field.
We will accept any suitable combination of education, experience or training.

All applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying.

Job Title: Sr. UX Designer - Mobile Shopping Experience
Job Description:
Senior UX Designer - Mobile Shopping Experience

Job description
Were looking for a Sr. UX Designer who is passionate about mobile app design and innovation. We need your mobile expertise and customer-focused mindset to push the boundaries of what is possible on Amazon's flagship apps on iOS, Android and mobile web. You will partner with a team of senior designers, design technologists, product managers, engineers, and applied scientists. You will both define and also take a hands-on role in crafting innovative user experiences from early stage product concepts to launch.

You will design experiences for current and future Amazon customers using their mobile devices. You will be responsible for inspecting what customers are doing today on their mobile devices and invent new ways to make their experience, easier, better, and more fun. You will be responsible for defining the future of shopping on Amazon and shopping in general and will guide the vision and customer experience for Amazons mobile shopping apps and design experiences used by more than 100 million customers weekly.

About the Hiring Team
The Shopping Design team makes Amazon more personal and human. We guide the vision and customer experience for Amazons mobile shopping apps, Navigation, community products such as, Customer Reviews and Profile, and features like Amazon Spark and Todays Deals. We help customers find value beyond the cart. Our future-thinking projects push the bounds of what it means to shop and experience Amazon. We are designers, researchers, technologists, and inventors. We only hire the best, and the best get better by learning from each other. Most of all, we invest in each of our team members by helping them build their unique careers.

Please include an online portfolio or samples of work demonstrating a history of creating customer-focused, simple and intuitive designs using best practices for usability.




Basic Qualifications

· 5+ years of experience as a UX designer, interaction designer, product designer or similar creative discipline
· Experience designing for native mobile apps
· Experience with mobile app prototyping
· Bachelor's or equivalent degree in Design, HCI, or related field or equivalent professional experience within the design field

Preferred Qualifications

· Passion for designing mobile experiences and defining new navigation constructs
· Experience prototyping and/or animation mobile app interactions
· A love of beautiful design aesthetic with an eye for detail, typography, imagery and color
· Ability to collaborate with team members from diverse backgrounds and skillsets and raise the bar for UX design within your team
· Experience working creatively around constraints and navigating ambiguous situations
· Excellent communication, presentation, and storytelling skills with an ability to present to and build consensus among other designers, PMs, and mid-level leadership
· Proficiency using prototyping tools like Principle, Framer and/or an ability to prototype directly in code
· Experience working on a collaborative multi-disciplinary team that includes other designers, product managers and software developers
· Ability to deliver high-quality solutions in a rapid, iterative design and development environment

Amazon is an Equal Opportunity-Affirmative Action Employer Minority / Female / Disability / Veteran / Age / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

We're building software products that combine cutting-edge AI (we've been published in ICML!) with empathetic, user-centric design that make the fresh food supply chain radically more efficient. The results are powerful: in live deployments we have demonstrated food waste reductions of 50%+ and profit increases of 25%+ for our customers—initial steps towards our greater mission of making fresh, nutritious food more abundant and accessible to all.

As one of the first Product Designers at Afresh, you will be responsible for working with our Product and Engineering teams to design and bring to life world-class products that power the future of grocery. You are extremely user-oriented, love bringing simplicity and elegance to complex problems, and geek-out over applying new technologies and UX/UI frameworks to solve enormous problems. We are looking for someone who is passionate about affecting global change, gets excited about tackling new challenges, and wants to work with a team who enjoy each other’s time outside of the office as much as we do inside of it!

We are a passionate team united by our mission to make an impact in the food system--we hope you'll join us!

What will you be doing?
-Deeply understand our customers and their workflows in order to design user-facing tools for both mobile and web platforms. These range from apps used by produce managers in a grocery store to dashboards used by executives in the boardroom.
-Run an end-to-end design process from user research to high-fidelity prototypes and mockups in order to build products that create value while inspiring adoption.
-Work directly with our customers in the field to understand their needs and validate product direction.
-Collaborate with the other members of the design team and cross-functionally with Product Management and Engineering to realize our product vision.
-Help to establish and maintain a design language and toolkit that will be used by the entire team and company.

What skills or experience do you need?
-3+ years of full-time end-to-end product design experience.
-The desire to dive into an industry with huge problems and opportunities in an effort to drive transformational change.
-Proven track record and portfolio demonstrating the ability to design successful user experiences.
-Cross-platform design experience (web + iOS + Android)
-Command of HTML/CSS, or another presentation-layer framework (nice-to-have)
-Great communication skills and inquisitive disposition.
-Strong alignment with our core values: Kindness, Candor, Proactivity and Humility.

Background
About 30-40% of food produced worldwide is thrown away, causing nearly a trillion dollars of economic losses, trillions of gallons of wasted water, and billions of tons of greenhouse gas emissions. In the US, about 40% of all food waste occurs at the retail level and downstream, largely driven by insufficient technology and manual processes.

Afresh seeks to tackle some of these big problems around food waste. Born out of Stanford's Computer Science PhD program, Afresh is the first Fresh food supply chain company. We bring the cutting edge of artificial intelligence to Fresh food to minimize food waste.

Our machine learning-powered supply chain solutions are tailored for the many nuances and complexities of perishables. Our first product is a store-level replenishment tool that optimizes the ordering of items in fresh categories -- produce, meat, deli, dairy, bakery, and prepared foods. The goal is to minimize waste and maximize in-stock rate, and consequently, profit.

So far, our results are in line with that goal! Our technology is deployed across the country and used every day—our customers have reduced their food waste by 33-50%+ and significantly improved their profits.

We're growing fast: we're in partnership with several large regional grocers representing 500+ stores and >$10B in revenue. Our backers include Innovation Endeavors (former Google CEO Eric Schmidt’s firm) and Baseline Ventures (first money in Stitchfix, SoFi, Heroku, Instagram).

We earnestly believe that Afresh represents a one-of-a-kind opportunity to have massive social impact, at profitable scale, by employing novel technology—and to have a ton of fun along the way.

Job Description:

Come join a diverse and collaborative team of researchers who work directly with a broad set of stakeholders to make the best social platform to empower people to build safe communities and connect with one another. The right candidates will be excellent communicators, knowledgeable about user experience design and research, passionate about social computing, comfortable in a fast-moving organization, excited to collaborate, and focused squarely on impacting the design of the platform.

Responsibilities:

Design usability studies and interviews that address both user behavior and attitudes
Generate insights that both fuel ideation and evaluate designs
Communicate results and illustrate suggestions clearly and effectively
Conduct research using a wide variety of qualitative methods, including in-depth interviews, participatory design, and usability

Education & Qualifications:

3+ years' experience in HCI, information systems, or related social science field
BA/BS degree in marketing, or a human behavior related field (HCI, Psychology, Social Science, Information Science, etc.)
MA / PhD preferred

Client Description:

This TOP social media company, headquartered in Menlo Park, CA, was built to help people connect and share. Over the last decade their tools have played a critical part in changing how people around the world communicate. With over two billion people using the service and more than fifty offices around the globe, a career at this company offers countless ways to make an impact in a fast growing organization.

Working here, you’ll:

Be part of their mission of community building
Work on the most visible apps and services in the social media industry
Work in an Agile environment, in constant iteration and problem solving mode
Take part in global internal conversations that are happening with stakeholders, wherever they may be located, who are the best at what they do

Job Title: UX Researcher for Public Connections & Monetization
Job Description:
Job Description:

Responsibilities:

Plans and conducts primary user research across all monetization areas
Effectively collaborates to identify user research opportunities
Partners with other insights and data teams to ensure user research efforts are coordinated
Helps define user success metrics that gauge how well user needs are being met
Develops and conducts generative and evaluative user research studies
Quickly synthesizes qualitative and quantitative data to develop a better understanding of our users, give insight into business/user value, and identify potential customer and business risks
Is a highly effective presenter, communicator, and influencer who can bring the voice of the customer to life
Helps teams understand customer needs, pain points, attitudes, and behaviors through thoughtful and actionable research that can informing both tactical and strategic efforts
Serves as a subject matter expert on our customers’ behaviors, needs, and values

Required Skills:

Build the designs that fuel global trade

The opportunity:


The Flexport Design team creates the end-to-end user experiences for our clients, their suppliers, and our service partners (Airlines, Ocean Carriers, Trucking Companies). Product Designers are key stakeholders in the full product development lifecycle, from working with their cross-functional partners to create the product vision to ensuring pixel-perfect implementation. The challenges Product Designers tackle at Flexport are complex. To be successful, Product Designers must be able to work cross-functionally across teams, think deeply, and communicate clearly. Now is an exciting time to join our design team as we lay the foundation for our vision of global trade.

As a Product Designer on Marketplace, you will help drive the end-to-end user experience for our marketplace products. You will focus on designing experiences to build a marketplace to enable us to sell the right product, to the right customer, at the right time, and the right price.

You will:

Conduct user research and gather data insights with guidance from senior researchers.
Present work in a range of mediums and fidelities throughout the design process.
Build prototypes to share and test concepts with stakeholders.
Incorporate and recommend ways to extend Flexport's design system.
Give and solicit feedback from other designers to continually raise our bar for quality.
Actively participate in the product designer interview process.

3-7 years professional hands-on design experience.
Strong portfolio of product design work illustrating many successfully launched products.
Please include a link and password to your portfolio.

About Flexport:


We believe global trade can move the human race forward. That's why it's our mission to make global trade easier for everyone. We aim to do this by building the Operating System for Global trade - a strategic model combining advanced technology and data analytics, logistics infrastructure, and supply chain expertise. Flexport today connects almost 10,000 clients and suppliers across 109 countries, including established global brands like Georgia-Pacific as well as emerging innovators like Sonos. Started in 2013, we've raised over $1.3B in funding from SoftBank Vision Fund, Founders Fund, GV, First Round Capital and Y Combinator. We're excited about the three big ways we're moving forward after our recent $1B investment from SoftBank Vision Fund in February 2019.

Worried about not having any freight forwarding experience?
Don't be! We're building the first Operating System for Global Trade. That's why it's incredibly important for us to bring people from diverse backgrounds and experiences together with our industry veterans to help move the freight forwarding industry forward.
What's freight forwarding and why does it matter? Freight forwarding is the coordination and shipment of goods from one place to another and it's what makes global trade possible. Flexport is on a mission to make global trade easier for everyone because we believe it can help connect the world and break down economic barriers.
We know this industry is complex. That's why we invest in education starting day one with Flexport Academy, a one week intensive onboarding program designed specifically to set every new Flexport employee up for success.
At Flexport, our ability to fulfill our mission of making global trade easy for everyone relies on having a diverse, dedicated and engaged workforce. That is why Flexport is committed to creating and nurturing an environment where anyone can be their authentic self. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, physical and mental disability, health status, marital and family status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law.

Coda is looking for a product designer to help us imagine the future of productivity software and creation tools. The document and the spreadsheet — the paradigms that still largely dominate how businesses and people operate — have remained relatively unchanged for the last 40 years. We believe the everyday user should be able to mold it into their personalized tool for work and life. As a Product Designer, you will talk to customers about their very specific needs and use cases, while creating a horizontal tool that will empower all kinds of people and businesses. You will balance designing tough micro-interactions with stepping back to think about the big picture. Work cross-functionally with Product, Engineering, Developer Experience (DX), and Marketing partners representing design at Apollo, providing and seeking feedback, and participating in planning. About you You have an excellent portfolio showcasing a strong foundation in typography, visual design and interaction design. Additionally, you have case studies that demonstrate the lifecycle of design and your impact. You have experience in product design organizations and working cross-functionally with Product and Engineering to develop strategy and rationale for new features and product directions. You have experience with user research methods and artifacts, such as card sorting, user interviews, journey mapping, and others. You have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You can adequately explain design decisions and rationale grounded design and usability principles, even to team members who do not share that background. You’re an excellent facilitator, guiding the team through ideation, research, and the natural ambiguity that occurs when defining a new feature. Bonus, but not required: you have experience working with remote teams and can effectively communicate and contribute in a highly distributed environment. Bonus, but not required: you are familiar with code development tools like GitHub, and have a general understanding of HTML, CSS, and the overall technical aspects of building for the web. This position can be done from anywhere in the continental US. Apollo is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace dedicated to pursuing and hiring a talented and diverse workforce. At Nova Credit, we’re on a mission to make financial access easier, no matter where you’re from or where you go. We’ve built a platform that enables lenders to access a single, predictive cross-border credit database to help underwrite immigrants and other global citizens. In effect, we are the first global infrastructure for financial identity to seamlessly move around the world. We’re passionate about financial inclusion, and committed to building a diverse and fulfilling work culture.

As Nova Credit’s first Product Designer you will help establish the company’s overall design direction. You will work collaboratively across the organization to visualize business and user goals through the design of features and experiences that serve the millions of newcomers seeking to establish themselves in the US each year. You will make a monumental impact on the company’s design and its users.
Must-have Qualifications:
5+ years or equivalent experience designing digital products
A knack for distilling complicated problems and generating simple, elegant solutions
A passion for visual and interaction design systems and an ability to understand the big picture while sweating the details
Ability to create beautiful, high-fidelity mockups of your designs using Sketch, Figma or other modern design tools ready to be handed off to engineering
Thoughtful communication skills and the ability to present design decisions and processes openly, clearly, and confidently
A hunger for feedback and willingness to use constructive criticism to better inform design decisions
An ability to work across multiple teams including product, engineering and marketing
An ability to create beautiful, high-fidelity mockups of your designs using Sketch, Figma or other modern design tools
An ability to work independently and make forward progress by proactively identifying blockers and seeking out ways to overcome them
A bias for action and tenacious focus on how your work impacts users and the business
Nice-to-have Qualifications:
Experience designing for a multi-sided marketplace
Experience in working with illustration and illustrators
Conceptual understanding of popular front-end frameworks like React
Experience designing products within the financial services industry

Everyone is welcome at Nova Credit. We are an equal opportunity employer where our diversity and inclusion are central pillars to our company strategy. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We are looking for a motivated UI/UX Designer to create / transform the workflows and visual layouts of our fintech-focused software web applications. We want our clients to love our interfaces!

To be successful in this role, you would ideally have some experience with B2B software interface design (or complex B2C design), knowledge of wireframe/prototyping tools, experience building a Style Guide, and the ability to craft workflows that satisfy complex sets of requirements.

Ultimately, you’ll create both functional and appealing features that address our users’ needs, help us expand the functionality of our products, and grow our customer base.

This role is an opportunity to contribute in a significant way to all of Nomis’s products, while being able to own the direction of the UX/UI function as it grows over time. We make small businesses more successful through better banking.

Our company is looking for a Product Designer to join our growing team as we enter a new phase of expansion We are a Toronto-based, venture-backed startup at the heart of the FinTech movement that is shaping the way financial services are delivered.

Our story

Our company's purpose is to eliminate the pain that small business owners face through their financial management and banking. To achieve this, we're rebuilding business banking from the ground up. Imagine you could start with a clean slate and think of a different way to deliver banking to small businesses. What would you change? What would you keep? These are the decisions that we make every day.

Our product

NorthOne is a mobile, tech-powered bank account built for startups, freelancers, and small/medium-sized businesses (SMBs). Poor financial literacy has an outsized impact on the costs and failure rates amongst SMBs, and we are on a mission to eliminate these problems. We are more than a banking platform, we are the world-class Finance Department that SMBs could never afford.

Our team

We design. Our Lead Designer has a decade of experience working with inspiring companies across the world. Our COO has helped build brands like Frank and Oak and has lectured at SXSW. Oh, and our CEO? 6 years at McKinsey working on digital customer experience in financial services. We're building a product that solves real pain vs. the imagined kind. Feeling it?

WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING
Creating, deploying, and iterating on product requirements through well-built prototypes and thoughtful usability tests
Helping to create deliverables that meet brand, product, and stakeholder requirements
Collaborating with our team of product managers and product designers to build out functional product features
REQUIREMENTS

Today you might be a Mobile Product Designer, UX/UI Designer, Interaction Designer or the equivalent in your company...or something that we haven't heard of yet - we keep an open mind.

The skills required for this role:
Expert knowledge of modern design tools (Adobe, Figma, Sketch)
Strong experience with end-to-end product design process. You've designed products or features in production mobile apps
You love taking requirements and benchmarks and building beautiful, functional product features based on them
You're a pro at wireframing and prototyping mobile apps
You have a strong perspective on what good product looks and feels like - and love discussing your ideas
Bonus points:
You've worked at a fast-growing startup
You have worked on a widely used mobile app or SaaS product
You want to work on a product that's mission driven and has a major impact on the lives of its users
Few people have been trained for this sort of role. If you are this close to what we've described but aren't sure, apply. Let's figure out together if this is where you could shine.

BENEFITS

Our mission is big and audacious, but we're assembling a team to take the challenge head-on.

As a Product Designer, you'll be joining a team that prioritizes:
People: Our company is more than just a business. We're a band of brothers and sisters supporting each other on our mission to rebuild business banking. We're really serious about mission, fit, and the people we work with. You'll be part of a rapidly scaling team that reflects these values and keeps this place special.
Diversity: You'll find yourself in an environment that values diversity and inclusivity. Excellence doesn't come in one flavor and neither should we.
Leadership: You're right in the thick of it, making critical decisions that will clear our path forward.
We offer full health/dental benefits, competitive compensation, and one hell of an adventure.

If you recognize yourself in this job description, let's talk.
